description:
Fantastic well made old fashions + made to order hand-carved ice cubes to go with your old fashion

While not my go-to drink of choice, really cool to see they have fernet flights 

Decor/ambiance strikes the right balance of date night/causal evening with friends

Overall Thoughts

Will definitely be back!
author: Eddie W.

description:
My friends and I used to go here fairly regularly, at least until it changed.

We went there on Saturday night for some birthday drinks. The bartenders took our basic order (4 beers of the same type) and came back and said we just ran out out that, indicating some other beer we didn't order. I also asked for a glass of water and they gave me a glass that held about a cup of water.

The most annoying thing was that the music was obnoxiously loud. This place used to be reasonably quite and lounge-like. Apparently now they try to replicate front row at a concert. We could barely hear each other and left after one drink.
author: Chris S.

description:
We were at another bar, but left cuz it was too crowded. Decided to check out Bar 821 instead. We walked in on Friday, August 10th around 10:30 pm. Our party of four easily found a table along the wall.

*Manhattan 821: kentucky bourbon, meletti amaro & bitters ($11)
*Amaro Blood & Sand: islay sgl malt, ramazzotti amaro, tuve fernet amaro & orange juice ($11)
*Mexican Alps: aromatic walnut tonic, ramazzotti amaro, chile tequila & lemon ($11)

I got the manhattan. I actually don't remember the cocktail much, but it I believe it was nicely balanced. Easy to sip on. I'm more into spirit forward, so if it was on the stiffer side, I probably would have remembered. I liked the vibe of the bar. Chill and laid back. It also has a beautiful ceiling. At night, it's gorgeous with the colorfully lite wall of liquor.

Now why am I giving this spot two stars? The restroom. There was only one toilet (for both men and women) and it was sooo nasty! It was as if the toilet had exploded. There was something unidentifiable around the toilet. The floor was flooded. And the smell?! A urinal from the depths of hell comes to mind. Thinking about it makes me sick. That stench was indescribable. Plus, the door lock was faulty, so the two times we went to the restroom, we walked in on someone.

Fun bar. Reasonably priced cocktails. But that bathroom. Only go if you don't plan on peeing. It's not worth it otherwise!
author: Elena N.

description: Hey Bartender don't throw sugar cubes to get people's attention. Also your sarcasm was a bit over the top and your drinks mediocre.
author: Eddie E.

description: Amaro is a spirit category that Ive had very little experience with, but that has changed a little bit after my experience at Bar 821.  This place is more on the smaller side, but it is still easy to grab a seat at the bar or a table if you come reasonably early. We sat at the bar and had positive experiences with both of the bartenders. I told one of the bartenders that I was interested in doing an Amaro flight. He customized a four pour flight of Amaro's and they were all great selections. Next time, I would probably only do three pours. The four pours hit me a little hard, lol. I  took a sip of the Boulevardier cocktail that my fiancé ordered and really loved this cocktail. The cocktails and personalized service are all worth stopping in for.
author: Yvonne I.

description:
Bar 821 is a pretty decent place to meet up for drinks with one or two other people. It is definitely not ideal for a large group of people. The place itself is dimly lit and creates a nice little ambiance. 

They do have a great selection of fernet and amaro, if that is your thing. The cocktails were a much better option for me personally. Fernet and amaro aren't really my thing but the cocktails at Bar 821 are legit. 

They do not have an extensive food list, just minimal options so I would not go here expecting a full meal just some snacks. Overall, great experience and I would go back again.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
A part of me almost doesn't want to write this review as it's so close to my house and a total treasure that i selfishly want to horde to myself. SADLY, i'm moving neighborhoods soon though, so y'all are in luck as i let the cat out of the bag!

i popped in on a Wednesday night to meet up with a date and found the atmosphere to be cozy and intimate, but not too frou-frou that i felt uncomfortable in a t-shirt and flats. the crowd is a relaxed mixture of locals which also helps keep the environment on the chill side.

the bar has a massive selection of Amaro drinks if that's what you're into, but they also do a fantastic job with classic cocktails of all kinds, and had a solid top-shelf selection of other spirits as well.

i ordered the boulevardier to start ($5 during happy hour, WHAT IS THIS INSANITY?!) and moved onto a classic whisky sour as the night progressed. the bartenders are the perfect level of cordial / friendly and aren't shy but also never overtly intrusive. personally, i like having friendly banter with bartenders whether i'm flying solo or with company, since it makes the whole place feel more neighborhood-y.

we didn't have a chance to sample the snacks but they looked delicious. as a single female, it's also nice to know there's a solid go-to place that i'd be comfortable hanging out at by myself without fear of creepers or obnoxious tech bros.

i'm sad to change neighborhoods but would easily make a trip just to come back here.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Quite literally stumbled on this gem of a place after dinner at barvale down the street. Did not know it was an Amaro bar (we were amateurs?) until we asked the bartender why Montenegro was hanging on the bar, as we sipped our beers. He teased us for our original order and poured us tasters on the house and we were sold. 

Highly recommend. Great vibes, knowledgeable staff and great drinks - as long as you don't order beers :)
author: Steph J.

description: Came here after work and this place gets packed.  They serve great cocktails, but the place is pretty small and crowded. It took a few minutes to have our drinks ordered and made.  They were playing some old school music.  Cool spot, but wouldn't recommend for big groups.
author: KB B.

description:
Bar 821 is quickly becoming my go-to bar in SF. Get there early enough to grab one of the comfy seats by the window or take a seat at the bar and mingle with any of the knowledgeable bartenders - especially if fernet or amaro are your thing. Also, happy hours ends at 7:30, which I love! 

Also, shoutout to Ade - he makes a mean gin gimlet and is an amazing bartender!
author: Sarah B.

description:
I loved this place. The drinks and the service are excellent. The bartenders Davide and Luis are knowledgeable and very helpful. They even gave us free olives and free shots. 
Try the flight of Amaros. So nice to discover all these different varieties.
author: Simon B.

description:
Decided to check out this bar after dinner at Barvale with a group of friends. Glad we did! Bartender was very accommodating and knife skills were impressive! Enjoyed watching him sculpt the ice cube for my whisky. Definitely a plus that they had a good selection of liquor there and he also took a shot with us. 

Great selection of music. What's not to like? Looking forward to my next visit :)
author: Jade D.

description:
Bar 821 is my neighborhood bar now. Initially, I didn't like it because it seemed uppity because of its large selection of fernet and amaro. But, it's turned out to be one of the least pretentious non-dive bars out there.

HIGH LIGHTS
It's never overcrowded. There's plenty of seating and standing room, and several bartenders. It's never too loud and you can actually have a conversation with others here. 

They will make you any drink, even if they haven't made it before. I asked for a cloverclub, but the bartender had never heard of it. However, he was able to make a pretty good one after just glancing at the recipe.

The bartenders are friendly. They actually make eye contact with you. Insane that that's not a given, right?

low LIGHTS

None. I always pick 821 to meet up.

OVERALL

This is my ideal bar. Never change, Bar 821.
author: Jiann M.

description: 5 years later, still unimpressed. The small-time hipster in me says this place has potential. The realist in me (after many visits) says this place is overcharging its patrons and could do with better-portioned drinks and service. $29 for two drinks, one being just a straight-up shot. Dude.
author: Danny C.

description: The best place to have a private party.  The space is fantastic.  The staff is phenomenal.  We got to bring in our own food and play our own music.  This is my favorite neighborhood bar.
author: Kathy D.

description: I liked this spot.. it's a charming bar with strong cocktails. We tried the Montehattan & the From Milano with Love, both good drinks. Even though we were there for Happy hour on a Sunday (5:30-7:30pm) it wasn't too packed which I enjoyed. Minimal options for food (I think I only saw a cheese plate on the menu) but certainly a good bar to checkout if you're looking for a relaxing spot to have a few drinks.
author: Ruby C.

description:
A quaint little bar and cocktail lounge in the NoPa (North of Panhandle) district. I popped in for the first (and hopefully not last time) before attending a concert around the corner at The Independent. It's a cozy little spot for those who appreciate good spirits and craft cocktails. 

What impressed me the most was their extensive selection and focus on Amaro and Fernet. They have every liquor imaginable, but judging from the two large boards on the wall detailing their selection of these two items, I'd say this is their bread and butter. I am sort of a fernet novice but have been slowly tasting my way through all the brands. Fernet Branca seems to be an across-the-board favorite and I've really grown to love the drier Fernet Francisco. The long, dark wooden bar here is perfect for sipping and savoring both. 

The number of fantastic watering holes in San Francisco never ceases to amaze me. You can add this one to my list of ideal places to enjoy a cocktail in an intimate atmosphere.
author: Alex L.

description:
Place is great, bartenders are friendly, nice seating. You'll have a great time

Don't be scared to try the canned food. It's of this world.

Also thank you to Kaled for being a great bartender. Showing us the best hospitality.
author: Nathaniel F.

description: Interesting little bar. It's specialities- digestifs. Amaro and Fernet, all kinds of, literally. Smells and feels like an herbal garden, friendly agreeable crowd, music is loud but tasteful. Bartenders are friendly, they do take their time, it's not the place to get hammered in succession, nor a sleazy pick up joint, feels more like a low-down hangout neighborhood joint. Like.
author: Juls C.

description: Decent bar with interesting decor and a fair amount of space. It has the typical bar stools and high tables with the corner having more comfortable seating. Their sweeter cocktails were good but their savory ones were actually a bit sweet, which was odd.
author: Mario B.

description: Its another place that great to go to have a drink.something unique,interesting and fascinating to try the different kind of Amaro and Fernet on their Amaro and Fernet Flights.My Favorite is Amaro Sibilia (Macerata/Italy) and Jelinek Fernet (Luhacovice/Czech Republic).Learning something new every day ..and cant beat the happy hour.it's $5.50 for a Negroni and Scottish Boulevadier.David and another bartender just amazing!!! Thanks for the great experience. Highly Recomended
author: Emanuel V.

description:
Here's a strange concept -- a bar that specializes in Amaro and Fernet. Yeah, so apparently they're Italian herbal liquors with digestive properties. Think bitters and vermouth. Suggested serving is on ice with sparkling water. It's not cheap so if you don't know if you like it, you can spend even more money to try a "flight" of them. My friend commented that it seemed like they were trying to make this absurdity a cool trend. 

We just happened to be in the area and it looked nice inside. It was only 5:11 PM on a Saturday so they'd just opened. The place was freezing and the metal seats felt like a slab of ice under my ass. I shivered while looking at the menu and we finally decided on one drink of the day (a $5 happy hour special) and one other cocktail ($11). They looked nearly the same with a cinnamon stick and orange peel. Hers tasted like sour orange juice, mine tasted like strong liquor with bitters. 

The bartender was wonderful. Helpful, sweet, fun to watch making the drinks, attentive. He asked us how the drinks were and the best we could say is "interesting." Three more couples filtered in while were there so maybe this place is doing alright. Not sure I will be back but it's an attractive hipster joint and I wish them luck.
author: Angelique L.

description: Was beyond surprised when I stumbled in here dinner on a Friday. Bartenders are so friendly and the drinks are top notch. The music is what sealed the deal -- this guys aren't messing around and one drink led to four because of their hospitality and delivered ambience. Will come again.
author: shannon s.

description: Decent bar for a drink, although the food options are quite limited with only charcuterie/cheese plates, octopus and one other offbeat dish I can't remember. We wanted more varieties for nibbles so left after our first drink, but the place is nice enough. Service was a little slow.
author: Steven V.

description:
It's my first bad experience since moving to San Francisco two months ago.  In short, they lost my credit card, poured out half our drinks when we were upset about them losing our card.  They seemed liked they could care less when they lost my card.  They then blamed me when they found it because they mixed up my name.  

Details:  We ordered cocktails, and the bartender asked if we wanted to keep the bar tab open.  I said yes, and he took my credit card.  The drinks were just ok, so we decided to go elsewhere. When they brought the bill and credit card receipt, we realized they ran someone else's credit card.  I went to bar to tell them that it was the wrong card.  They then asked for my last name.  They came back and said they couldn't find my card even though it was only 10 minutes after I gave him my card. He kept looking for my card.  He asked me my name again. I told him my first and last name.  He said he couldn't find it.  He never said he was sorry.  He just kept saying that he didn't have it.  He then asked me to see if a charge showed up in my account. I had to go online to see.  Nothing was charged.  He said he didn't have the card but he clearly didn't seem to care.  We then asked why he never said he was sorry.  Then they took our glasses, which still had half of the drinks left, and emptied them into the sink.  

We kept saying it was a red Wells Fargo card, and he would rudely say he knows what the card looks like.  Three minutes later, he asked me my name again.  He then found it.  He then seemed to blame me because he didn't understand my name.  He then charged me full price for the drinks (even though they dumped half of them) and he charged my credit card.  He took no responsibility for his actions.  I hope he took the charge off of the other person's card!

From the moment we arrived, they were not very welcoming.  The vibe is snobby hipster, and they seem disinterested when they thought they lost the card.  Be careful with these very careless bartenders.  I'd stay away.  There's plenty of places in the neighborhood with a better vibe.
author: Anthony N.

description:
This my first negative review on Yelp- and Bar 821 more than deserves it. They gave us the wrong credit card when we closed our tab- they ran someone else's card with our bill and gave us that person's card. That was extremely careless, to say the least. When we noticed and told the bartender, he then told us he couldn't find our card after a brief look around his area. He didn't seem apologetic or concerned. We asked him to keep looking, since losing and replacing a debit card is a serious thing. He again briefly looked then leaned on the bar and said it wasn't there. After a bit of back and forth, we started the process of canceling the card he lost- during which time they cleared our half full drinks and threw them out.  We AGAIN described what the card looked like and said the name on it for the fourth time. He didn't seem interested in finding the card he admitted he lost and didn't even offer an apology. Luckily, the waiter happened to see the card sitting right by the bartender's cash register- at which point the bartender charged us for our drinks even though they threw them out while half full. 

It was quite possibly the worst service I've ever gotten at a bar. I understand that things get misplaced, but his lack of concern and lack of even a cursory apology was shocking. 

Needless to say, we won't be going there again. And folks who care about their cards and their financial security shouldn't go to such a careless and apathetic establishment.
author: Waymon H.

description:
Love their sangria and champagne cocktails. 

You can also bring in your own food!!

4 stars because hours are a bit short and not much beer to choose from
author: John Z.

description:
This is a fun, intimate bar.

NOT good for groups.

Smaller tables.

Good stop for a cocktail after dinner.
author: Maura M.

description: Went for a date on a Friday night around 7pm and it was small but plenty of seating. I even got one of the tables... probably cause we were there so early. Apparently they're obsessed with fernet there and I had a couple of different ones and they were so good! Guys behind the bar were really sweet and friendly. Love this place already and it makes me realize why this area is up and coming... great bars!
author: Ruby S.

description: Thought they had fernet on tap, but just in bottles. No food or light snacks which it could use. Chill and out of the way. Good for a drink or two, but not much else. Needs some kind of distraction like a TV or even some pinball. Even trivia cards would be fun.
author: Eric J.

description:
Great wee bar, I'm not quite sure what Amaro is and I'm not a fan of Fernet but they have other things too. Nice vibe comfortable couch seats next to the window. Bartenders are cool, attentive. 

The Peat & Peat is damn good (Peaty Scotch, Allspice, brown sugar, angostura and orange) if I ordered it back in Scotland I'd probably get hit with the whisky bottle, but when in Rome and all that. 

Opens at 5pm by the way, not 4pm.
author: Chris L.

description: I came here for election night, which involved sitting at the bar for hours in stunned silence while nursing many a vermouth cocktail (a first, and their HH special).  That said, the one positive about that night was the discovering Bar 821, their vermouth cocktails, and their impressive list of amaro and fernet choices.  I'll be back soon with a fernet-loving friend to check out their amaro and/or fernet flights.
author: Joanne G.

description:
I guess Monday's are pizza and Fernet day.  This cute little bar with its caged up liquor was the first stop to our night.  He got the Fernet flight which I thought was supposed to be best served AFTER a meal but whatever, any excuse to drink.  I wanted a lychee cocktail but the bartender recommended a special drink not offered on the menu.  I'm not a fan of cocktails or mixed drinks but this drink was exceptional.  Not too sweet, not too strong, perfect for this lightweight.

The bartenders were very friendly and knowledgeable not to mention, they have a great sense of style.
author: Linda N.

description:
What? I can't hear you over the increasingly loud Euro trance! What?

Bartender wasn't familiar with their own happy hour specials, and the pricing wasn't much of a deal if any. The bar was empty, and I still couldn't hear someone seated next to me, shouting. The great reviews of this place remind me there are different crowds for every bar, and they're not all universal. 

Go to Big Bar instead.

Edit. We were charged $10 and $12 all during happy hour, not $6.
author: Jay T.

description: I wouldn't really recommend getting food here. I really enjoy their drinks but there is definitely rooms for improvement on the food menu.
author: Penny S.

description:
Weehee I think I found the perfect spot for grabbing drinks on a weeknight. 

As you walk in a warm cozy feeling sets in. You look to your right and see 2 big boards with their selection of Amaro and Fernets. Since both of these are digestifs I suggest going here after dinner.

I tried the amaro flight. Don't remember the name exactly but it had the cardamaro. That's a great way to introduce yourself to the world of amaro. They also have flights of Fernets. 

Bartenders are friendly, people are happy. All in all a great way to drop in for a drink on a weeknight.
author: Priyanka P.

description:
Cozy neighborhood bar with incredible cocktails! You want a negroni? an Old fashioned? Or how about champagne cocktails?

All cocktails are $7. Cash only. 

Go.
author: Janice C.

description: Met a friend for a glass of wine. Turns out if I ordered the charcuterie plate($16) the wine($9?) was free. Charcuterie was simple but good. Than another glass and the cheese plate(no free wine, it's okay:). Cheese also good. Both had crackers, no bread. They have a very extensive drink menu. Spend several hours there. Nice setting.
author: S Blair P.

description: Nice bar. We came here on a Sunday evening. The place was completely empty. Seven of us walked in and brought the party! Bartender was nice, drinks were yummy and the bar's really charming. Would definitely come here again!
author: Priti K.

description:
Cute little place. Kinda reminds me of a dive bar based off the size and how dark it was in this place! They were in the process of revising the drink menu when we went, so many of the drinks I'd seen on-line weren't available because the current bartenders weren't familiar with them. 

Don't expect to go in here for basic vodka cranberry, week ummm because they don't (didn't the night my friends and I were there) have cranberry juice. 

Good music playing and the bartender was super patient as we tried to decide what we wanted to drink. We ended up just telling him the liquor we wanted and if it should be sweet, tart or sour and he did his thing and made 4 wonderful cocktails. We'd all go back next time we're in town!
author: J T.

description:
Jon is the best!!! People but on Fridays lil Jon makes a special appearance. He is the best make
Sure to stop by this place!! Good vibes
author: Sydney R.

description:
I live about 2 blocks from Bar 821. Have been going since it opened about 9 year ago - at this point will ever go back and likely never to any of the Dajani Group restaurants. 

On my most recent visit, as soon as I sat down I was asked if I'd like some sparkling water.  Many places are serving on the house sparking water with the ease of using the soda systems, so I said yes.  As I was looking at the menu, I looked up and realized a bottle of sparking water had been placed down with some poured in my glass (opened before I knew it).  I realized maybe he is going to charge me for this.  I'm not one to be confrontational and in my head, if he truly ended up charging me, I'd much rather alert management of the ridiculously of doing this at a local bar.  In the end he did - at $5.  It was happy hour - beers are $5 at most places. 

I loved the old Bar 821.  With the change to an Amaro Bar, I've still given it a college try and wanted to support.  Before writing bad reviews I did alert management via email and they have failed to even email me back - guess they don't care and want this sort of behavior to go on, which makes me not even want to support any of their restaurants.
author: Josh M.

description:
Granted I don't make it over to Divis as much as I should, how had I never heard of this place?? It's fabulous! After dinner at nearby Nopalito, we were looking for a nightcap before heading home and Bar 821 nailed it. Fun ambiance, not too crowded, and a glowing cocktail selection. 

First off, don't get overwhelmed when you walk in. It's a smaller bar and they have huge menus up on the walls. Admittedly, I was at odds not knowing what any of the listed spirits / liquors were, but they also have a paper menu with signature cocktails. You can order wine or standard drinks, but their cockatil line-up was so fun! I was on a mezcal kick so opted for two different drinks that included this, egg white, and a plethora of other ingredients I'd never heard of. Super tasty. Staff is hard-working, attentive, and certainly entertaining. My only (very small) gripe is that they seemed understaffed. The place was not crazy crowded, but with one man behind the bar and an eager crowd, it took some time to order. 

All in all, such a fun spot that I hope to venture back to sooner than later!
author: Brianna M.

description: Now that's a place for fernet & amaro. Be adventurous, just ask a friendly waited what a today's special is and go for it -- you won't regret.
author: Kat S.

description: Very cute inside and $7 cocktails during happy hour - can't beat it. Had a thyme infused old fashioned and the bartender was really friendly. A great stop before dinner at NOPA.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Never busy, somehow, no matter the time, even at 8:30 on a Saturday.

Very knowledgeable and friendly bartenders, a huge selection of amaro and fernet, and a well-stocked bar. Not much beer selection, but if you want some place to just sit and drink and chat, this is the place.
author: Gabe B.

description: Cool hip bar that doesn't get too crowded but word of advice: don't ask the bartender for recommendations because he will upsell you. We tried to order what we wanted, but instead he said "oh you should really try this drink instead, it's like a better version of what you want". We agreed to get the different drinks since he kept insisting on us trying it and when we got the check saw that he had upsold us on top shelf versions of what we wanted (bourbon and fernet). Know that it's our fault for ordering but would be nice if he told us "oh and it's also 3 time as expensive as what you initially wanted". if $$$$$$$$ ain't a thing for you, then order away, but if you're like most people, don't let the bartender upsell you
author: Derrick W.

description:
A nice, small neighborhood bar with an impressive selection of liquors and cool atmosphere.  This was the first place that came up on the Yelp app when we realized we still had some time to kill before a show at the Independent.

The bartender was working hard yet still made eye contact with us as we sidled up, telling us it would be a moment. A professional at work.

Drinks were strong and tasty.  They made a mean Old-Fashioned for my friend P.  And my Bombay and tonic was perfect.

My only complaint was the place was packed at 9 pm on a Friday and space was quite limited. I made an attempt to hit the single, unisex bathroom, but the long line made me do an about-face and decide to look elsewhere. It was time to go to the show anyway, just a block away.
author: Dan B.

description:
Bar 821 has a lot to offer but are horribly understaffed on busy weekend nights. It's part of the Dajani Group, who also owns Nihon Whiskey Lounge on Folsom which is awesome.
 
Saturday night was the second time I've been out to Bar 821. As tradition goes, my friend sets off for San Diego mid June, so I try to squeeze every last hang time out of the month of May that I can. So we had a nice light dinner and wine at my place, then cabbed it over to NoPa for a change of scenery. 

The place is very cute and upscaley feeling without upscaley prices. We both had specialty soju cocktails: she had the Lychee Mermaid and I had some kind of "Gin" Negroni. Her drink was sweet and subtle, mine tasted like earwax. Yes, I know what earwax tastes like, judge away. Surely it's difficult to mask soju in a gin flavor. And, real-talk, I didn't know it was soju until after I ordered. 

Around $8 a cocktail and a very ncie ambiance, I can't complain too much. OR CAN I? One bartender for the whole place? Really? It's NoPa. A ton of people head this direction for a similar purpose as my friend and I. Also, just want to say, it's misleading when a bar back looms around behind the bartender and sips water.
author: Crystal C.

description: Definitely a very interesting bar. It was fun trying out the various fernet and amaro based drinks. The vibe was good as well. Look forward to coming back here for more experimentation.
author: Ankur V.

description: Loved this quaint and cozy bar. The bottle ledges are sick, the whole room of the bar is dark and pretty small but somehow it was the perfect place with the right ambience to grab drinks with a friend. The bartender (Davide) was attentive, kind, and the best kind of bartender you'd want to be making your drinks. He took care of us; we didn't feel pressured to order more and he asked about our drinks at the right moments. He misheard one of our orders and thought we ordered a beer, and immediately told us not to worry and that the beer was on the house. Cocktails are well made and delicious (we asked for bartender's choice for my last drink), the bar's vibes are on point. Will definitely come back here if I'm in the area again.
author: Ashley J.

description: Oscar is one of the best mixologists I've ever met, and his hospitality is unparalleled.  It was my first time in this bar, and I felt like I've been going there for years.  I say mixologist and not bartender because this guy is far from tending bar.  He is more of an artist than a bartender.  His knowledge of flavors in composing cocktails is among the best of the best.  This is not an overstatement even though this is a somewhat understated bar.  Go here.  If you like hand crafted cocktails and you know something about them, this is your place.  If not, come here anyway and learn!
author: Brent Z.

description:
My aunt recommended this spot while I was in town visiting from Austin. I told her I was looking for a chill place with a full bar that would be quiet enough for conversation on a Friday night. 821 fit the bill on those criteria, but where it fell far short was in the condescension of the man-bun sporting bartender. As we approached the seemingly well-stocked bar, I searched the shelves for their vodka selection, only to find out that vodka is déclassé in this hipster paradise. 
"Do you have Grey Goose?" says I, with a winning smile. 
"THIS is the only vodka we serve..." says man-bun, pulling a sad bottle out of the well. 
"...Oh... Um, is it any good? Why are you hiding it under the bar?"
"I guess it's fine. This is all we have, LOSER." (I added the 'loser' part, but just barely)
"Oooookay, I guess I'll try it, for $12. Thanks ever so much."
We took our trailer-trash vodka drinks and slunk away from the bar, popping our Hubba Bubba, slapping our flip flops on the polished concrete, and hiking up our acid-wash dungarees tied with rope, hoping only to drown our shame in off-brand booze. 
If you're going to have a bar, or any business, for that matter, try not to make your patrons feel like they don't deserve to grace your door. It's a sure-fire way to piss off the hillbilly masses.
author: Vanessa B.

description: Unique is the word for this place.  I was not familiar with Amaro and this bar offers a wide variety for beginners and pros alike.  The bartender, John was fantastic and helped my wife and I choose something we both liked. He also made me an excellent tequila based "old fashioned".  We will be back!
author: Larry H.

description: Our cocktails were so thoughtfully created by Oscar. Superb! I'm a huge Moscow mule fan and their Italian mule was definitely a delicious spin. The drinks were great, the atmosphere sexy yet comfortable, and our mixologist was simply a cool dude that made you feel like a guest.
author: Nancy J.

description: I love this place, but I'm frustrated. I'm a local who wants to make this my regular place, but 3 out of the last 4 times I've been there, they've attempted to over-charge me for drinks I didn't order. The first couple times, I thought it was an honest mistake by lovely bartenders from Italy who are just a little scattered. But the third time they charged us for drinks we didn't order... let's just say it has me wondering if it isn't on purpose. I'll update my review of things change: I'm not giving up on this place yet, but I'm close.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Bar 821 has a good Monday night happy hour with half price bottles of wine (choice of one white and one red -- they come in ~$16/bottle). It's a comfy place to lounge and hang out with friends when you're looking for something low key. Definitely also a plus that they let you bring food in (and Little Star is across the street)!

Recommended.
author: Amy D.

description: Bleh. It looks like a super chill, relatively luxe hangout spot - but the terrible dance music is so. insanely. loud. you can't even think straight. On top of that, our tiny drinks were $12 each and mine (prosecco, chartreuse, bitters) was room temperature. It took so long to make, even though the place was only half full, that I didn't want to ask for a replacement - it was easier to just chug it and get out of there.
author: Rachel M.

description:
I live a few blocks from this place, but hadn't been there in quite awhile. I stopped in last night (seriously, it's probably been well over a year since I've stepped foot in the place) and REALLY liked some of the tweaks they've made! The big change being they now serve liquor, and have a pretty extensive drink menu (written on a cool chalkboard) with tons of signature drinks. 

I don't know if the chalkboard & light-up liquor display are the only changes they've made, but honestly, those couple tweaks just gave this place a whole new vibe I really like. 

The only reason I'm not bumping to 5 stars is because I was here early on a Wednesday night for a drink with some friends. I'd like to see what it's like on a busy Fri/Sat night to get the full effect.
author: George A.

description: They're charging $8-9 for draft beer. I recall paying $1.29 at the Bean Bag for a local beer. This was a few years ago and obviously things change, but that's the neighborhood I moved to. I'm not sure who Bar 821 is catering to, but the same beer next door at Mini Bar is $4. I mentioned to the bartender that these were AT&T Park prices and he just shrugged and handed over a  $9 beer... and it was flat.
author: Alan C.

description:
A big group of us wandered in just after they opened, and we got a warm welcome even though the bartender was still getting everything prepared. 

Their cocktails are pretty inexpensive for the city ($8) and delicious. Comfy booths, a larger-than-expected wine list, and just being a fun place to hang out - these round out the list of reasons I'll be back. 

That, and it's fun to judge your friends when they order the happy hour special: $5 for a shot of Irish whiskey and a PBR. 

Keep in mind, it is cash only. There's an ATM there, and a few up and down the street.
author: Colleen K.

description:
Raised voice.

Growing up Mom did it all the time. Apparently calling her out of class so she could pick up the latest version of Legend Of Zelda was not a good choice.

Here at 821 despite two very good cocktails for aa very good $17 can't give more than three stars. We pretty much had to yell while conversing over rather loud music.

Detracted from an otherwise relaxed and inviting vibe with a friendly bartender.

Tone is down and stars will be up.
author: Jason B.

description: Good hipster drinks but can someone please fix the speakers, decent music but God it sounds bad.
author: Nick A.

description:
Another Cash-Only bar, 821 I would rate just a tad above Madrone because it's MORE chill when it's not busy.  Drinks are good and cheap and they bring dog-friendly to a new level by stocking Milk Bones for your companion.  

Bartenders are extremely friendly and even offered free drinks in trade for our group's dog which says a lot about the atmosphere.

I definitely recommend 821 and hell it's pretty close to a lot of good eats.

Again though, CASH ONLY so bring your greenbacks.
author: Chris C.

description:
BEWARE!

As a visit time visitor and neighbor in the area I always wanted to try this bar. Unfortunately I had to pay a few extra dollars for drinks because of the bartenders greed. I didn't notice when ordering but I was charged $3 dollars more a drink then what was posted on there menu.

If you need to make rent this month you should of asked. I have a bad taste in my mouth and will never return to this bar. 

Your drinks sucked too.
author: Hammed K.

description:
A chill little spot to meet and catch up with pals. Dim, but not dark, and a sexy kind of relaxed. You know, like a subtle pair of dark jeans that make you look kinda hot in all the right places. 

The ladies and I chilled in a corner, sipping on fizzy lady drinks and beer, while an A's game played in the corner. Good times.
author: Loli L.

description:
The bars start to blend together as you run along divisdero and Bar 821 is just another one in the long line of options in this area. If you are looking for a story or a place that you have to recommend to your friends to go to this probably not going to be it. Nopa, La Urbana and Candybar will probably fit that bill better. But if you actually live in the area or want to avoid the tons of overflow from NOPA and the Independent this is a nice place to duck into. It doesn't get to busy there and you can talk to a couple people over a nice mix of drinks. 
The place has some pretty decent cocktails but this is the kind of bar you go into knowing what you want. There is usually only one bartender and they are pretty knowledgeable about the drinks. It's a no frills bar that is set up like a frills bar. The décor is inviting and there is usually ample seating. It feels a little more upscale because of the deco so if you aren't looking for dive bar but don't want to be surrounded by a ton of people Bar 821 and its neighbor Mini Bar are great alternatives to the hip and overpriced neighbors done the street. 
Its still expensive though with about 10 dollars per cocktail but you are probably used to that by now. 
This is one of those places you will end up frequenting more and more because you want to avoid the show and dance of going to the other more popular places down the street.
author: Nick R.

description: It's a cute little bar with decent drinks, nice decors, and semi-friendly service but there was nothing too memorable about this place.
author: Wendy H.

description:
Have I mentioned how much I love my neighborHOod? Bar 821 is one of the *gillian* reasons why I do...Apologies, my yelpies for not reviewing this gem sooner. 

Quaint, dark, and comfortable is the best way to describe Bar 821. Great diverse crowd of HOod and non-HOod dwellers. Love the vibe and ambiance, and be sure to check out the interesting flicks on their flat screen. I've been here on numerous occasions (meeting Popchip angel and Tsaritsa for the first time, pre-post dining with L, D, or M, and even a few dates, etc.,). 
Best place to sit are the tables by the window. Take heed, as it can get really noisy if super crowded (typically Friday & Saturday nights). 

Great selection of wines, champagne cocktails, and a few beers on tap. 
My fav specialty drinks are the are the Lychee and Pomegranate champagne cocktails. My most fav aspect of this bar is.... wait for it....tada.... The HO is on tap here. Oh Mylanta! My beloved HOegaarden is in my HOod bar! Gotta love it! 

Bartenders are always nice, and usually just one tending. So if it's crowded, you might be waiting a bit for your bevy. Recommend going for Happy Hour during the week, and be sure to check out their daily specials and the signage by the front door. FYI, they close earlier than most bars, and closed on certain days. 

Cheers and see you at Happy HOur!
author: Gill C.

description:
A small, well decorated bar with lots of seating and moderately priced drinks ($7/cocktail). I liked the vibe. It's a cool place, no doubt.

But on a Thursday night, there was only one bartender and it must have been over 10 minutes before we got our drinks. I ordered two drinks and she said it'd be a minute. 10+ minutes later and comes back to me and looks to me as if I haven't ordered before. I said I already ordered and she continues to give me a blank stare, kind of like a "what do you want" look. I repeated myself and she finally made it.

She seemed to consistently take in at least a few orders at a time before she fulfilled them, which is probably why she forgot. I saw others wait a long time, too. 

There really needs to be another bartender.
author: Andrew D.

description: Just stepped into this spot for a quick drink, I got a Virgin mojito, my ladies got la diabla, and gin and tonic with Lolita gin and all three drinks got our attention,  they are delicious! !
author: Licy B.

description:
So their crazy cocktails tend to be too citrusey (citrus is good but so much you pucker is not) but really how often can you pay $5 for someone to work that hard on your drink. It's rare.

Stick with the champagne cocktails, they're a little ligther on the citrus
author: Misha T.

description:
Yaaaaa! Liquor liquor liquor....liquor liquor liquor! Mini bar has a competitor. Let's watch these two spirit enthusiasts duke it out for cocktail supremacy.

It's a little more comfortable to lounge there a little more room. Good drinks, that Fog City was my demise.
author: Jackson D.

description:
Not a bad place per se, but I had a very disappointing experience here.

I came in with my boyfriend for a decompressing drink. We ordered two glasses of prosecco... and then, maybe 30 seconds later, asked for the whole bottle instead! We were sitting at the bar, RIGHT IN FRONT of the bartender, so there was NO DELAY of communication here. 

Well, the bartender had poured us the rest of an open bottle (maybe 1.5 glasses) and then opened a whole bottle that we ordered.... Great, right? Well, she made us pay for the TWO glasses that she poured. WHAT??!!! It's prosecco, it's CHEAP! Why do this?! It was WHOLLY UNPLEASANT on principle. 

I am NOT coming back. I'm going to Mini Bar, where the drinks are tasty and bartenders are AWESOME!
author: Liza P.

description:
I am in love.  This bar is awesome.  We didn't have trouble securing the big table in the back.  The chairs are comfy.  We don't have to scream in each other's ears to have a pleasant conversation.

Mon-Fri, 5-7:
$3 for champagne and specialty cocktails?  I'm sold.
$3 draft beer.  Booyah.

All the other times the drinks are around $6, which still beats some SOMA happy hour deals.  :) all around.

Yes, the bar closes at 11 every day.  Yes, it's cash only, so come prepared (they have an ATM in the front).

Try the wannabe bloody mary cocktail.  It's effing delicious!
author: Jenny L.

description: I've been here more than a few times now, it's a good small divvy bar with cheap booze and that intimate dive feeling about it.
author: Beni R.

description: One of my favorite bars in SF. I live close by and pop in every now and then with my friends and my boyfriend to get a drink after work. They just renovated and got that incredible amaro and cocktails based on it. Highly recommended!
author: Julia K.

description:
$3 champagne and sake special coctails from 5 till 7 pm! I loved the bubbles and black currant drink. Small but flavorful and unique. Try it you will like it! 
But try it during happy hour :)
author: Anelya S.

description: Always a good spot for a drink or two.  Grab a seat and enjoy a few cocktails.
author: Dilly M.

description:
I'll start by saying, I love the word, "NOPA."  I don't know why, but I do.  The acronym doesn't make any sense, given that it represents North of Panhandle, but it's such a adorable yet charming word.  Like, "do you like to get your hair pulled?"  "NOPA!  But an occasional tug doesn't hurt."  :)

Bar 821 is a dark venue.  Very minimal lighting...sorta sexy and mysterious.  Like a cloaked gentleman in the corner that you can barely make out his silhouette, but fantasize about what's underneath.   

I don't remember if they served wine, but the beer was satisfying.  It's the perfect place to grab a drink and canoodle.  You might have to yell a bit since the noise level is pretty loud.  

The best part:  I overheard a guy talking to his buddy about how he wanted to have a threesome but only if it were with two girls.  Oh really, you don't want to share your lady with a dude?  Get out!  Gotta love the adult drink convos that occur late at night.   Did you have fun?  YUPA!
author: Soo Jin K.

description:
It's a love / hate relationship.

You love it b/c they serve boozes, just wish they could get the hard liquor license, I would definitely come again. Hoogarden and Chimay on TAP! 

Did you hear me or do you need hearing aids?!!!!

You hate it when it closes early. WHY?!

this is my sad face : (
author: Stanley K.

description: Nice decor, fun sort of pricey mixed drinks, but probably too popular for its own good; lots of crowds & that means waiting, noise & jostling elbows to get by.
author: Mordicai C.

description: Danielle serves up epic cocktails for only $7! Chill neighborhood spot, great drinks and excellent customer service. Danielle also rocks it with fantastic happy hour deals. No question: this is the best bar in the Western Addition!
author: Deb B.

description: My little after work spot. Love the happy hour specials. The bartenders are cool and the place has an intimate quiet vibe which I like. I'm not trying to deal with crowds after work. And this is the perfect place.
author: Melissa T.

description:
I've found a great place to hold my AA meetings...alcoholic amigos gatherings..that is...

They have awesome happy hours--$3 cocktails and beers...
I had a couple of bubbly and lychee drinks tonight..then some bubbly with ginger...the some bubbly with bitters...it went on and on..til I got really hungry and had to make a run for my tummy.

The bartender is super chill and cool..the crowd was a bit iffy...shady at best..but who cares when you are there with your amigos?! I can see this as a perfect place to tie a few on while you wait for your Little Star pizza...or hell..run over to Popeyes after you've had a few....
author: Mimi T.

description:
I love drinking, but I hate hard alcohol. Yes, yes, I graduated from UCSB, so this was a big problem for most of my hard party nights, but I still managed to out-beer most of my peers. Heh. What I'm trying to say is that I love wine and beer bars. In fact, if prohibition struck twice, but they only outlawed vodka and it's brethren, I'd be fine with it. 

Now that we've gotten that out of they way, and only one person is left reading my review (Hi Mom!), we can get into the greatness that is Bar 821. 

I went to Bar 821 on my birthday before a concert at The Independent. I had been craving a good pitcher of sangria, and what do ya know? I found one here. The sangria was awesome, it had a hint of what could only be described as "christmas spirit" (cinnamon), and was the perfect color. Sangria should not look like hot cheetos, guys. 

Sufficiently buzzed, I continued to order off Bar 821's awesomely afforable menu ($3.50 -$7.00). Champagne cocktails are my new best friend. Try them all, but definitely try the one with fresh lemon juice (the name escapes me, but I got her number). 

Here's what I do:
-Sangria
-Champagne cocktails
-It's my birthday, I can have one more.
author: Chanti B.

description: Of all the bars I've visited on Divis, this is my favorite.  Delicious, very reasonably priced drinks, cute seating area, great vibes.  The only reason this gets 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the extremely unfriendly bartende.  She took one look at me and said, "I need to see some ID" before even saying "Hi" or "What can I get you?"  It wasn't crowded, and yes, I get that you need to see my ID and I admit I look young even though I'm 24, but I'm a paying customer and would have appreciated being asked politely instead of in an accusatory, borderline hostile way.  Without that blip, this place would have been perfect!
author: Jen O.

description:
I didn't know 821 is associated with Corkage and Tsunami right around the corner. So, they specialize in sake, beer and specialty cocktails...no other liquors.
For a Saturday night at 10pm, the bar was relatively empty, but a good crowd was starting to arrive. I thought it'd be more crowded than it ended up being, which is awesome. There was no problem finding a seat either at a table or at the bar. Music selection was great, and not too loud so I didn't have to yell for my friend to hear me...that's very important to me.

$5 for a beer, $4 sangria (which I was told isn't the greatest)
author: Alyssa G.

description:
NAY:
- The sangria wasn't that great.  It had an overpowering cinnamon taste and smell.  
- The bathroom was gross and there is only one (unisex).  10pm on a Friday night and the floor was all wet already.

YAY:
- Lychee champagne cocktails
author: Jeanne L.

description: I love that this bar is in my neighborhood and I can get a pretty well- crafted cocktail for $7... Can't really beat that for value! Five stars because a nice bartender gave me a free cava before closing. That love is real man
author: Jin T.

description:
Came for drinks on a Saturday night. Be aware they don't serve hard liquor and the beer list is not extensive.

Started with a ginger soju drink (disappointingly not gingery enough). Tried their lychee champagne drink (delicious). And beer-wise they have some belgians which I like. Ended up getting a pitcher of sangria (really good, very strong cinnamon). Perfect to split between 2-3 people. All drinks were around $6-8.

My biggest complaint is that they had last call way early (like 11:30pm on a Saturday). And they cleared the alcohol off our table just after midnight (some sort of rule). This was very disappointing.

Environment: Small, dark, not terribly inviting. Seating at the bar or small tables with chairs and a booth bench.
Service: Order at the bar, sit anywhere. I think there was only one girl working when we went.
author: Kailyn G.

description:
It's no lie that this place has got to be one of the most chill bars I have ever went to.  Their Happy Hour is indeed, a HAPPY hour ($3.00 cocktails..and not JUST beer or ONLY certain cocktails.. MOST cocktails).  The actual place isn't too big, so it's quite cozy, the lighting is good and their tables and chairs are low and comfy for the most part.  

What I must say is that their drinks are delicious.  I like the fact that they incorporated soju as a key liquor as it has a naturally sweet and mild taste by itself (to me anyway ;] ) and they have a plethora of different champagne cocktails as well.   I had three Lychee Mermaids (they were THAT good) and it all ended up being 9 bucks not including tip.  The Korean Special was quite delicious as well.

The only thing that I have a problem with the fact that they only take cash and you can't keep a tab.  That's pretty annoying and although I understand this during a busy time, we were the only ones in that bar that day.  

Other than that, it's quite a delightful place!
author: Meena N.

description:
This is the place otherwise known as "Birthday Bar."  

My birthday is 8/21.  This is Bar 821.  What happens when a girl whose birthday is 8/21 goes to Bar 821 on 8/21???  LOTS OF FUN!!!  My last two 8/21 birthdays have included extended stops here and I love it!  I'm shameless in whipping out my ID to show the door guy as well as the bartenders (even though no one asks for it!).  I'm always treated extra-special since we share a common number!  Once the bar tender produced a piece of cake with a candle.  How great?!

I live three blocks away and come here regularly, not just because it's "Birthday Bar."  The bartenders are always great and really friendly.  The vibe is laid back, especially if you're grabbing a post-work beer with friends.  I just love Bar 821 and all my friends wish they had a "Birthday Bar!"
author: Austin S.

description:
Sorry Nicole, we people who are "so marina" have descended upon your adorable Divisadero Row.

We just love the lounges.  Stylish, fun, good conversations, great bartenders, people who look good without trying....

This place should stay open later, like 4 am.  The bench-like seats along the wall are built just right for extra-curriculars, just like a good couch, soft as hell but not too slippery, nice and sturdy with plenty to hold onto for appropriate leverage...just kidding.....sort of.

This place is how you want your living room to feel.  Plus I've always wanted my own bartender.
author: Mike V.

description: Great local spot. Nothing fancy but if you are in the area and looking for a comfortable, not snobby place to grab a beer or even something fancier this is your place. They have a adequate liquor selection and had some interesting beers on tap.
author: Kenyatta D.

description:
One of the most laid back bars in the city, I love coming to Bar 821 when I'm in the NOPA area. It is right across the street from Little Star Pizza so it's a great place to come when waiting for a table at Little Star. There are many reasons to love this place:

 * Chimay on tap (and a good selection of other premium beers)
 * Sangria
 * Very chill atmosphere
 * Friendly staff

Last time I was here the bar tender asked us to choose the music we wanted to here, which was a nice touch.

The only bad thing about this place is that it's cash only. While they have an ATM there it does get annoying to constantly be pulling out your wallet when you know you're going to be there for a few drinks. I'd prefer to just open a tab and pay at the end.
author: Bryan B.

description:
I seriously need to get a tattoo. If I had one, I too could hang out with the cool kids at places like Bar 821. 

Walking in with my Banana Republic self here on a weeknight I am reminded just how uncool I really am. The crowd here is definitely hipster and am willing to bet that everyone (but me) had at least two tattoos. 

The bar offerings are good, however the wine by the glass list can probably use some work. I was impressed that they had Duval Belgian beer by the bottle. You rarely see it and I took full advantage and ordered one or two or maybe three.

My friends were all about the strawberry mojitos and some weird champagne drink that included some strange fruit thing that resembled an aliens head. Yes, I know what an aliens head looks like.

The music was eclectic and heard everything from Blink 182 to Echo and the Bunnyman and a twangy country tune that I actually liked. It may have been a little on the loud side and it made it difficult to have a converrsation, but we were there to drink so it was all good.

The tables are a bit cramped and had to keep shifting my legs around  so I wouldn't trip anyone.
author: V B.

description:
This place is really awesome. The decoration, ambiance, music, the drinks. All was great. But it closes at 11pm.

I am not American, so I find all the restrictions really strange. Minimum age is 21 to drink... Well, I'm old already so whatever. But then the bar only serves wine, champagne sake and beers. Something about the license?... I guess some people might be put down by that, but for me it's not a problem too. I had two different champagne drinks, and I liked them a lot. And the tap Chimay was great. The beer selection looked great to me, and good prices too. I can't tell of any food, didn't try it. Bathroom was fine.

A game was on TV, but it didn't seem anyone was there to watch it. I saw _some_  people there, mostly friends and couples talking, it seems. Anyway, I was liking the place a lot. The music was really really good, lots of soul and funk... But then, they had to close at 11pm. That's just crazy. Is it something about the license too??

So everything about the place looks great. But it made me go home earlier, and I have to take a star for that. And it looked like it was much emptier than it could be _just_  because of that. So because this problem seems to be really hurting the place indeed, I must take a second star.

Best place to go if you want to have some good time on a place where it will be really easy to sit and to get your orders. And then come home early. If you want that real memorable "fun times" parties, and totally "spend the night" somewhere, look for another place.

Maybe it just pretends to be a good place to get the night started, whatever.
author: Nicolau W.

description:
By the time I hit this bar, I had a couple beers and shots of whiskey in me to help fuel a small party. We got inside and there was no seating (it is a smallish bar, very long but no real width) so we stood behind the bar stools near the bar. We were able to get our drinks really quick and soon enough a couple seats opened at the bar.

We stayed for a few more drinks and overall we had a good time! I didn't mind standing at all. Everyone seemed to be coming and going anyways, so it wasn't long to get a seat.

I like the low lit atmosphere and the back lounge area. It is swanky and a bit sassy, but I felt right at home. There were people dressy and others who looked as if they got back from snowmobiling.

I like this bar.
author: Angie P.

description:
$5 cocktails?  Don't mind if I do!  

I tried a drink that was raspberry syrup and hibiscus with champagne, and it was delicious--dangerously so, in a "Wow, this doesn't taste alcoholic at all!" kinda way.

The drink menu is really expansive with a lot of specialty cocktails between $5-6, which is reasonable, I'd say.  

Bartenders are nice, and they let you bring food into the bar, as long as you pack out what you pack in...kinda like back country camping.  More on this shortly, but this bar gets some stars for friendly service.

I liked the atmosphere here, and one of the first things I noticed was how clean it is.  Not even "bar clean"...straight up clean.  There are some tables, so the 3 of us actually brought in our pizza from Little Star across the street and devoured it right then and there.  

This is where the cleanliness factor becomes even more important than normal.  Don't get me wrong--I love my dive bars.  However, when you're trying to eat, it's nice to have a clean surface and not feel bad picking up the piece of sausage you dropped on the table and then eating aforementioned table sausage because you're such a fat kid.

**Heads up - cash only!  (They do have an ATM inside, and there's a Wells Fargo ATM on Oak right off Divis.)
author: Alice C.

description:
Small, nice neighborhood bar (it says so on the window next to the door before you enter). 

--DRINK--
I had the Lychee Champagne Cocktail. It's a mix of champagne and lychee juice/syrup and topped with one lychee. The flavor was okay. TAO restaurant in Vegas makes a killer Lychee martini with bits of lychee. 

--OVERALL--
If you don't like hipster, Hollywood type place, this is the place for you. It's unfussy and down to earth.
author: Ann N.

description:
What a cute place!

My man and I went on a Friday night at around 9:30, there was a good handful of people but it was not overly crowded, it was perfect. The drink menu was good, I think it could be better they also have a nice wine list that I hope to check out next time.

A nice place to check out!
author: T C.

description:
Tried their Sangria: a heaven. 

It was pretty busy Friday night, but the awesome bartender was running the bar all by herself so effortlessly.  Reminded me of my life as a barista where I used to run the entire coffee shop all by myself.  It was dark days : /  So kudos to the bartender. 

They have mojitos made with Soju! This Korean MUST go back and try it! 

Dark and loud enough to do & speak raunchy stuff ;-)
author: A K.

description:
Quiet watering hole to chat with friends. It is a nice enough location without standing out as special.

No cards and a broken cash machine put a halt to the afternoon at 821

I would visit again if in the area but wouldn't go out of my way to return.
author: Chris M.

description: Happy Hour ends at 6pm. :( It starts at 4pm but peeps are just making it back from work by 530ish. It was empty and probably for that reason.
author: M R.

description:
A nice, small bar and it's usually quiet enough to hear the people you're with.  The staff is great too.  They do have a minimum bar selection.

The sound system sucks though!   My friends and I noticed how terrible it was and the next time I went up to order a drink I intentionally looked around to see what they were using.   Are those overpriced and underperforming Bose speakers I see hanging in the ceiling?   Please get rid of those things and get something decent.   (if you're thinking, "but I thought Bose was really good", then you're mistaken)    Those little square things were definitely not designed for a bar.  The sound is super tinny and it sounds like an amplified transistor radio.
author: Scott W.

description:
I guess I didn't pay enough attention when reading the reviews here - Bar 821 doesn't do spirits.  When people say "cocktails" they mean sake, shochu, and champagne.  They make some pretty tasty things with them (the Soy Lovely, e.g.), but it just isn't the same.  Also, the sangria was disappointingly bland.

It was crazy packed and noisy as hell last night, but we later realized that was because of Art Walk and so maybe isn't the normal scene.  Oh, and despite being totally packed, they closed up and kicked everyone out at 11pm.  :-/
author: Stephen D.

description: One of the best handmade cocktails I've had in SF (a whiskey sour.) The wait staff knows what they're doing with the drinks, and the crowd was lively without being a pain. I can't wait to go back. Cash only.
author: Nik K.

description:
I suddenly realized that I was stuck on 821 because of its (old) bartenders. And, admittedly, the fact that it's close to home.

It's all different now. I've lost my love for it. Where are all my good bartenders? Where is the good neighborhood service? What happened to Joey?
author: D'arcy N.

description:
Came here last week and to my dismay i found out they no longer have the 22 oz huge beers at happy hour but rather a lowly pint.. I still love this bar though and they have the chillest bartenders in the city i'm sure of it...

A part of me died that day though.
author: William S.

description: Pretty cool little bar. I like the whiskey/beer happy hour combo.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Joe the croatian is the bartender?  wait, what??  but I AM the "Korean Special", why am I on the cocktails menu? 

good times... good times...

another one of those dark and halfway sleek skinny bars, but a pretty decent one for the neighborhood.  Not sure if they're trying to be ironic or just cheap but the cash only thing when they're trying to be a wine bar too is really really annoying.
author: Nikki F.

description:
Yeah, yeah I really like this place! 

Went there on a Friday around 6:30, not too crowded, assume I missed the happy hour rush that is very typical in the "Vis" (shhh that's what i call Divisadero)

Great decor on the walls, tattoo influenced, with a tattoo parlor next door. Coincidence? Great Happy Hour prices $3 for most beers and champagne cocktails! oooh la la. Donnie Brasco on the tube followed by The Darjeeling Limited! Oh, be still my heart.

Little snarky on the service but I'll chalk that up to a bad day maybe. Definitely will go back and spend more money there. Great for pre-show at the Independent down the street.
author: Tony C.

description: A pretty cool place, i like their light beer --- gold garden?( i am not sure the name). The space is small and comfortable. It's good for relax. I love it.
author: Aichi L.

description:
OOh, I like this place.
I like the cozy, laid back seating.
I like the layout of the bar.
I like the inventive champagne cocktails and wine selection.
This is a great date spot.  You can converse without yelling at 
each other and flirt shamelessly over candlelight.
We wandered in here on Valentines Day, taking an evening stroll
after a wonderful dinner. Of course I ordered the Valentine cocktail:
champagne, blueberries, chocolate in the bottom of the flute, 
garnished with a strawberry. The bar also offers a great happy hour 
with $3 cocktails and Belgium beers from 5-7. . .
author: Kia B.

description:
Heaven, to me, is a bar where I can booze it up with a large, luscious, and frothy Hoegaarden and not worry about whether I'm "cool" or "attractive" enough to be on the premises.
 
Seemingly plucked from the streets of Amsterdam, dropped on Divisadero, and populated with a smattering of neighborhood denizens, heterosexuals and the people who love them, Bar 821, my friends, IS that bar.
 
You'll find a great line-up of beers and bubbly champagne cocktails here.

There's also a chill, discreet, almost DL vibe, and if you know me, you KNOW I'm all about the DL thing.  Until, that is, I get a call from his wife accusing me of being an ankle-grabbing homewrecker because she hacked into his email and found all our sordid correspondence, thus forcing me to call him and say "LOOK BITCH, you betta choose between wifey and your 2.5 kids or my exotically starved body," OF COURSE he chooses ME, all is wonderful for a few months until he asks me to undergo a sex change operation, so I use some ruse like "Let's visit the Sears Tower in Chicago, sweetie" in order to drag the motherfucker on Jerry Springer where I call him out and he throws chairs and punches Steve the security guard in the face and tells the audience "Y'all don't know me, suck my *BLEEP!*"
 
Something like that.

ANYWAYZZZZZZ, I had a wonderful time here celebrating the birthday of the sexy Sassy S.  The fabulous dotRachel was there of course, along with Quinn S, Jenniflynn, Bucky K, Lauren S, and AKA G.  I also invited myself to lesbian night at Mecca since I STAND STRONG with my Sisters in the never-ending struggle to do what we want with our VERY LARGE SEX ORGANS.  Unfortunately, I didn't stay long enough for cake or porn consumption, but I heard both activities were very filling.
 
But WHO IS THIS CHEWIE G people keep mentioning? Was he there? Do I know him? Most importantly, DOES HE HAVE A YELP PROFILE?!? 'Cause you bitches KNOW I don't associate with anyone who isn't on yelp -- fucking PLEBES!!!!
 
Okay, okay, I'm joking. Chewie is a really great guy: cool, sweet, and charming. He told me he used to have moobs, though now they're morphing into meaty, muscular pecs that I wanted to massage with Crisco.  Yeah, he's THAT sexy.  For a terrorist.
author: d s.

description:
I forgot about my idea of having them make me a kier royale with lychee juice in it. OOPS but I did order another Lychee Champagne for $6. YUM. I like Bar 821, and you will too.

Btw, CASH ONLY. 
And yes, there is an ATM inside.
author: Heidi C.

description:
You know you're in trouble when your cat tells you to leave the house. 

Our dialog went a little something like this:

Mr. Biscuits (the cat): "Get off the couch mom, I'm sick of your moping. If I have to watch one more hour of "Sex and the City," I'm gonna lose it." 

Me: "Okay Mr. Biscuits, but where should I go?"

Mr. Biscuits: "I'm just a cat, how the hell should I know?" 

Okay, Mr. Biscuits is OBVIOUSLY not a Yelper, so I call my girl. J-Len, I need to get out of the house, out of my sweats, and interface w/the real world. I'm looking for somewhere close, should I feel the need to run home, and with kind lighting. She says, meet me at Bar 821. It's only 4 blocks from your house, Ms Lazy Bones. And they have a limited bar menu, which should keep it nice and simple as not to confuse your addled little brain. It's been awhile. 

Me: "Mr. Biscuits, help me find an outfit to wear."

 It's hard to tell from a cat's expression, but I chose black and white stripes, which he seems to only wear. (His wardrobe is rather limited.) Relieved to have the house and remote control to himself,  he blinks in my direction as I leave. 

Mr. Biscuits: "Pick me up some cheetos while you're out."

Rrright, I set off into the strange, yet exciting world. J-Len was right -- only 4 blocks away, and the lighting kind and cozy. It's a weeknight, so not too crowded, the tempo and atmosphere just right.  I had the cab, she the champagne.  

A good night, definitely worth leaving the couch for. Thanks for the push, Mr. Biscuits!
author: Suzanne R.

description:
What a lovely little neighborhood bar!

If your friends are a bunch of outrageous party people who regularly get banned from establishments during massive saturday night blow out parties, I recommend this bar on a weeknight.  This place bans people.
author: Christopher K.

description:
You know you're someone when members of the Yelp Illuminati like Peter Mmmmm., JT F., Heidi A., Bucky K., Darin I., Lauren S., Mick F., Jenniflynn R., Quinn S., and even the much mourned and beloved Chewie G. show up to your birthday party.

So Sassy S. you should feel like you've made it.  You're somebody.  Me, well, I'm nobody.  Since it was your birthday party, and not my birthday party, and no one showed up to my birthday party, and I sat alone in a corner with a party hat on and a sash that said "Birthday Girl" and ate 3/4's of a German Chocolate Cake with my hands.  But that's a whole other review.  Of cake.  5 stars.

Bar 821 is small and dark and loud.  They let you bring in your own pizza and porn (Sounds like a typical Friday night for you, huh?  Stay classy.), which anyway you spin it sounds like one hell of a party.

Happy Hour until 7 gets the birthday girl drunk enough to start telling people what they are doing wrong in their life and talking about how she is a prude, and at the same time lets Rachel G. not feel TOO bad about sending her home with JT and Peter and a bag of porn and chocolate.

I haven't heard from her yet.  

Should I be concerned?
author: Rachel G.

description:
Things that make luis m forget that he can't order a jack n coke:

- $3 Guinness Draught
- super cheesy, topping heavy pizza
- Anal Bandits
- ridiculously large nipples
- Trojan Vibrating Rings

They might not be able to satisfy your craving for the hard hootch here but it's nonetheless a very cool spot to chill with a few people, have some drinks (beer, wine, champagne, sake...), and waste away an evening.  Very clean and stylish on the inside, plenty of seating space, and a great bartender all make this place very inviting.
author: Luis M.

description:
If you like champagne and testicles, this is the place for you.

And by champagne, I mean champagne, and by testicles, I mean lychees. 

I'm not a huge fan of lychees, or testicles for that matter, but the Stella here is free flowing and delicious...unlike the skunk-tasting brew I had at Casanova, that bush n' boob bar in the Mission.

Bar 821 is good people, and by good people, I mean people who juggle cocktails, buy copies of "Anal Bandits" from the liquor store down the street, and bring their giant dogs for me to maul. 

The bartender talks real sexy-like, the seating is cushy, buttery and plentiful, and the space is chic and modern. My one gripe would have to be that the acoustics here sort of blow monkey balls. When you get a bunch of rowdy Internet dorks all riled up over a hooker in a tube top of sexy destruction it becomes a bit deafening in these tight quarters.

Also, big ups to any bar that allows you to bring in outside food. Thanks you beautiful babies for letting us eat pizza. And by us eating pizza, I mean me burning the crap out of my hand on Ed's fourth piece of meaty meatington surprise pizza.
author: Sammy S.

description:
This place reminds me of the bathroom at the Mint.

But it's in the neighborhood and the happy hour is a deal and half: $3 mocktails and beer. Can't be too picky, I guess.
author: Megan W.

description:
I'm a fan of this bar, hey it's in my neighborhood, but I have to say I'm sad they do not serve hard liquor and also have some odd opening/closing hours. 

That said, the space is cozy and intimate, and you definitely feel like you're in a local - yet hip - establishment.
author: Nish N.

description:
Seriously sexy little dark (but not TOO dark) intimate bar in NOPA with a great wine selection and a friendly appealing SF diverse crowd.  Filled with mission hipsters, hot tatted mission chicks, hot non-tatted marina chicks, fixie bike boys, first date couples, 20th date couples, fresh-faced college kids and middle-aged corporate tools (me).  Everyone fit in nicely and no one seemed out of place.  And, the bartender is an incredibly friendly welcoming guy. 

I love this bar.
author: Jay Z.

description:
Note: neighborhood secret bar is no longer a secret. get over it. i'm over it.  just like I'm over thinking that madrone could be my own private drawing/eye-candy/antique sofa lounge, or that Popeye's may one day get kicked out of the hood. 
Anyway, what surprised my friends and me during our recent visit, were the champagne drinks! I've been to 821 dozens of times, but never ventured beyond wine or beer. I'm not a huge lychee fan, but i found myself with a tall slender bubbly glass including a lychee at the bottom! Another darling champagne drink, called "Valentine"  included a strawberry & a chocolate chunk at the bottom...for roughly $4...I just about fell in love...
Bar 821: smooch.
author: Nicole L.

description:
I just discovered the coolest little hole in the wall bar last week and sure, 221 of you fools scooped me, but I don't care, this place is rad and it can use another review!

I was having drinks with my friend who rarely leaves the 4 block radius of his house, and since I am only drinking vino these days, he suggested this place. As I walked up the block, I was looking for some place called 821 and of course, it's the address. I don't know what it is about bars that take that direction, but they always seem to be pretty cool. Take 83 Proof for example. Maybe too many bars are over thinking fancy titles, when your addy is a good route to go. Just sayin...

Anyhoo, when I walked in, I instantly loved the fact that it was nice and dark. It wasn't dark and divey like I generally tend to gravitate towards, but instead it was dark, modern and very cool and still approachable and comfy. Definitely not an easy decor cocktail to mix.

The bartender (Joey) working that night instantly made me feel at home and definitely scores my coveted 5 stars for blasting Richard Ashcroft for the entire time I was there. He must be psychic since RA is one of my all-time faves!! 

I will definitely be returning! The wine was deelightful and reasonably priced, the crowd was very neighborhoodie (not the sweatshirt line) and all in all, it was a damn fine time :)

Yay, 821. Simplicity at its finest :)
author: Stephy S.

description:
Maybe there's a legitimate reason for this, but last night the bartender at 821 was completely rude- telling me and the two males I was with as soon as we walked in the door at 10:30pm that "they were done", and that we "had to leave", when there were at least 15 other people inside the joint sitting at the bar and at tables with full drinks. Everyone turned and gave us prejudging death stares.  He could have been polite about it.  If he had been nice and explained to us why, I wouldn't be so bitter.  It was the way he talked down to us that left a bad taste in my mouth.

I felt like he judged us when we walked in, deemed us to be not hipster enough and told us to leave without giving us any sort of reason.

Although they probably assumed we weren't locals, I live four blocks away (in SF since day one), and I'll never be back.  First and last time.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
If Bar 821 were a drink, it would be the Black Velvet.

The pairing of Guinness with Champagne is the perfect contrast between the everyday and the extraordinary that makes this place so unique.  It's one part lounge, one part neighborhood watering hole, one part hipster dive.  And it works together beautifully.

I've been here twice now and both times I have felt so relaxed and at home.  The noise level never gets too high, and people are respectful of each other.  The crowd is mixed, from people waiting to eat at Tsunami to the guys from Everlasting Tattoo a few doors down to the regulars.  The first time I was there, I watched a really cool skateboard video and just hung out while I sipped my Black Velvet and waited for my Little Star Pizza to be ready.  The next time, I brought my friend Michael and we had a grand time shooting the shit and enjoying the $3 Happy Hour cocktails.

That's right, 5-7pm Happy Hour = $3 for everything.  You be hard-pressed to find a better deal than that.  

I prefer the Champagne cocktails to the soju drinks, although my friend liked the Apple Mojito a lot.  For the champagne cocktails, I would recommend the Ginger one or the Lychee.  There is also a Chocolate/strawberry one that I would love to try when strawberries are in season.  As for my beloved Black Velvet, it will have to remain but a memory, as this lovely concoction is now off of the menu. 

Lighting is low (good for dates) and seating is relatively comfy  (bench seats and padded chairs, or bar stools) - and the bathroom has these amazing walls that you just have to see for yourself. 

It's a simple bar with a good atmosphere and very friendly service - a place where you can relax with friends in a chill neighborhood environment.

Note:  Cash only.  (At Happy Hour, you can get 6 drinks for $18! Yeah!)
author: Liz S.

description:
Last Friday a friend of ours convinced us to swing by Bar 821 for Happy Hour. The night before we had drank and ate and spent too much, therefore we had promised ourselves a nice quiet Friday night. We arrived at 5:15 and ended up stumbling home at 2:30 in the morning... Our ship crashed upon the rocky shores of intoxication after hearing the Syren song of good cheap drinks. Happy Hour is that good here. Technically it lasts two hours, but during those two hours everything is three dollars. Granted they don't have a full bar but they do have great beers, wine, champagne and soju cocktails. 

We drink our way through happy hour and then went  around the corner for some sushi. We eat and drink our way through dinner and evidently we lost track of time because the waitress asked if we would like to finish our bottle of sake at Bar 821. Bar 821 is owned by the same people that own Nihon and Tsunami, where we were eating at the time. For the inconvenience they gave us each a free drink at the bar. Just when I thought I was out, they pulled me back in...

We walked back in to a much more crowded bar, but they had put us at a reserved table with our drinks waiting on us. The sun had dropped during dinner and the bar wasn't near as bright and looked much better. Do you know of any bar that looks better during the day? That's not to say the bar isn't pretty because it is. It is very tastefully decorated. Throughout out the night service was top notch and I am sure we will be coming back in the near future.
