Hopefully, next time my internal fortitude will be a bit stronger and I will be able to call it a day after Happy Hour ends...
author: Bucky K.

description: Fun local bar in Nopa, great place to get the night started or just chill and have drinks with friends.  Friendly bartender and laid back atmosphere. I live down the street so its always a good spot to stop by for a drink.
author: David K.

description:
This tiny little bar is around the corner from its sister restaurant, Tsunami. We wandered in while waiting for our table to open, per the recommendation of Tsunami's hostess (and after walking in and immediately out of Fly because it smelled like barf...YUCK). 

We got scolded like schoolkids for playing with the candles on the tables. We like hot wax...what can we say?!! SORREE! But other than that, this place is alright. 812 is quaint -dimly lit (uh, candles...that we couldn't touch), cozy seating, yummy Soju cocktails, and right around the corner from kick-ass sushi.
author: Esme W.

description:
Five stars for decor, atmosphere, service and patrons.  

Tragically, no bar can earn five stars without hard alcohol.
author: Quinn S.

description:
I don't know how this bar can have so many reviews and still retain that easy "neighborhood" feel. Used to be a good, unknown first-date bar: laid-back, dark, anonymous...well, no longer. Last night there was a table or two occupied by non-NOPAians, but generally you'll run into your friends and neighbors here. 

The drinks are DIRT cheap. $5 for all Soju and Champagne drinks. Yup, $5. I had the champagne ginger thing....$5. The soju-lychee thing....$5. Another $5 and my ass is sliding off the chair....all in good humor, of course.

Happy hour is $3. Ok, that's enough reason for anyone to come.
author: Carrie R.

description:
Inevitably in any city, a person finds their regular place--  and I was going to 821 after work all the time. 

The place is not fussy at all. 
.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Bar 821 is a great place to hang out with your friends if you are looking for a mellow evening. Awesome champagne cocktails (I had the ginger one, which was yummy) and a good selection of beers and wines. I asked the bartender, who is very nice as Starla D. has already mentioned, for a beer recommendation based on beers I already like. He recommended the Hoegarten Vanilla which was right up my alley and had a subtle hint of vanilla. 
The atmosphere is great with comfy seating, pleasant lighting, and funky music videos playing in the corner.
author: Cyrelle D.

description:
2 blocks from my house.
22 ounce beers.
Steps from the 24.

I have found my new favorite bus stop.  I will be in here regularly waitin to catch the bus to the 'stro.  Its small, dark, comfortable, really comfortable and cheap.  I love it.
author: Ian M.

description:
Suede/velvet seating, low lighting and cozy space make this champagne bar a refined yet relaxed hangout for neighbors and those in the know. It's intimate and well serviced, two qualities the establishment preserves by under-advertising itself. Some of their house rules include "If you have found the place, don't tell anyone" and "Doors close to [further] visitors after 11pm" as well as "We only serve nice people".

Indeed, they only serve nice people. Everyone there was smiling and polite. None of that meat market mentality here. Also, there was an oasis of sexy accents there that night - British, particularly. Rowr. The bartender from Manchester is a sweetheart and will offer suggestions for adventurous tastes. Ask him about the ABC, which was created there, courtesy of said bartender and fellow Yelper/local Gabriel T.: http://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=RDwgEc8o15O2wqu-YQu29Q

Tap is a selection of European beers. Cocktails are $4, Champagne cocktails $5, and they have a nice one-page list of wines as well. It's all there in the handy laminated menus they leave out on the tables. Don't worry, it's actually legible in the candlelight.

I'd love to see a collaboration with their sister restaurant Tsunami, or Cafe Abir, to bring snacks/food pairings to their wines, champagnes and beers.

Eat before or after to absorb the alcohol by going across the street for good pizza - Star Pizza and Stella Doro. And no need to drive, when the 24 Muni stops just at the next corner down.
author: Clar L.

description:
I love this place because (1) it's totally chill, and (2) I like their champagne cocktails.  It's a great place to hang out and catch up with friends.  It may be crowded, but it never gets too crazy.  One big exception:  Art Walk.  (Should be re-named ArtDrunk, but that's another review waiting to happen...)

One thing I'm not keen on is that you can't run a tab.  Oh well.  I'll deal.
author: CC L.

description:
The last thing I expect anyone to tell me when I walk into a bar is 'You're too young to be here.' Now granted, two years ago, this would have been a legitimate complaint because I would have been 20 and thus technically too young to be at bars. Thankfully, when I was 20, I was at UVA. And when you're 20 and at bars at UVA, you're more akin to a senior citizen than a fresh fish. 

However, apparently being 22 and at Bar 821 on a Wednesday night, I'm too young. The time that elapsed between me walking in the door and the bartender's unprovoked issuing of this statement was roughly 26.5 seconds. He then proceeded, completely unwarranted I might mind you, to assault my 22 year old friend with the belligerent denunciation that his taste in women was limited to drunk, blonde sorority girls. This may or may not be true. 

Now, I really, really wanted to like this bar. Prior to my 26th second in this bar, I quickly fell in love with the low slung leather lounging couches studded with low rising circular tables, the easily manageable (un)crowd, the relaxing lighting and the $3.50 Coronas. But it's difficult to love a bar when the snarky bartender picks out your lil-bit buzzed and slow-on-the-draw friend as a target in his lame attempt to impress girls with his supposedly witty repartee. I wholly understand he was trying to impress the girls to our right. But c'mon, you're the bartender, if you're so desperate to impress them, give them a damn shot.
author: Tom C.

description:
Summary:  A fancy local hang-out

Drink:  Very tasty
Bartender:  Friendly with an accent
Clientele:  Locals with a smattering of couples on dates
Music:  Old-school hip-hip...nice
Decor:  Couldn't say, place was very poorly lit
author: Stacy F.

description:
I really don't know what to say about this place.

Usually, I am sitting there--with a friend, date, family, etc--quietly forming my yelp review in my mind, thinking of the good, the bad, the ugly...but, I just don't know what to say....

Basically, there is nothing that super stuck out to me about this place...kinda un-memorable. The main thing that I did remember: THE BLARING/OVERLY LOUD REGGAE MUSIC.

Other than that...I liked that that bartender (who wore awesome jeans) came out from behind the bar to take our order at the table, the sangria was quite inexpensive ($4), and the bathroom was modern. There were two tvs going...one with the football game, and one with some black and white movie. Not the best lighting if you are one a first date with some dude from the Internet, because it's hard to see. But it's not intimate and quiet enough for a romantical date either.
author: Misha F.

description:
I love coming here. I moved to the area JUST so this could be my local bar.. OK not true, but it's definitely my favorite.

If you're looking for something that's slightly more subdued and a place where you can hang out and bullshit with some friends, this is it. They don't play the music too loud, the drinks are great and seating is always reasonable. Great place.
author: Ryan V.

description:
So I have this thing where I seem to take my first dates here for many reasons.

1. It's close to home (that way if it was a shitty date, at least I got a few free drinks and I'm three blocks from home)

2. It's fairly quiet. It's nice to actually talk to the person that I'm with, as I prefer to not be drowned out by music. 

3. Happy Hour - I usually only go here when it's happy, as the $3 pints and apple mojitos aim to please.
author: Jasmine B.

description:
Dark candle lit bar with some intimate seating that makes for a great happy hour spot with a few friends or taking that special someone. 

The happy hour deals here are fantastic. Where else can you get a pint of Chimay for like 3 bucks? Crazy! All the belgian beers here are solid and you can't go wrong. Wine list is alright also and they have some Sake or Soju mixed cocktails as well. minus one star for no spirits - they don't have the license. 

Big bonus though as they let me bring in two Little Star pizzas from across the street to feed my ravenous friends after a long happy hour.  They even gave me some paper plates they found in the back! 

I'll definitely be back.
author: Morgan H.

description:
On the plus side, $3 champagne cocktail happy hour (including a lychee variety, always a positive).  On the minus side, I saw major hipster crack hanging out of skinny jeans at the bar.

I like the small and intimate setting, but the few scattered people there were a bit random, and I don't know that it gave off the whole "where everybody knows your name."  Oh, and the bartender kind of gave one in our party shit for double-fisting during happy hour, but really, what difference does it make if she chugs one separately after another or sips two slowly at our table?

For now this is more of a three star place for me, but $3 champagne cocktails and fear of the wrath of Mimi bump it up to 4.
author: Tanya N.

description:
I'm slightly ashamed to admit that last night was my first night in Bar 821...the closest bar to my flat, and I'd not been there until last night.

Shameful.

But, I did finally go and really enjoyed it!  Granted, it was for a neighborhood networking event, so hard to get a pulse on what the crowd would be like, but it's cool and they make some interesting drinks!

What I like most about this place is that it seems unpretentious....and not overly hipster like some other bars in the hood.  Just a local neighborhood bar with a cozy atmosphere and friendly people.  If I were a regular drinker, I'd definitely want this to be my 'local'.  Since I'm not, I probably wont come here on a regular basis, but will definitely be back!   Awesome happy hour specials ($3 drinks until 7pm!)
author: Melanie N.

description:
I love this bar.  It's a block and a half from my house, which makes it super convenient, but really it would be fabulous even if it weren't so close.

The atmosphere is great.  Not too "cool" (i feel comfortable no matter how I'm dressed - grubby and dressy alike), but it's got great lighting and decor.  I'm not afraid I'll stick to anything when I sit down like a lot of locals.  The music, while I've noticed it loop more than once, is a great mix of old and new, all of it fun.  The customers are there to have fun and relax.

I've only ever been served by one bartender.  He seems to be a really chill guy who keeps up with any pace.  I feel good leaving him a good tip.

I never drink the sake drinks, but their beer and wine selection is good.  

Perfect for a small group or a date.
author: Meredith M.

description:
circlin' the western addition...as if trainin' for the nascar oval track...circlin', circlin', circlin' and circlin'...lap 4....pit stop..."drats~!..a driveway~!"...circlin'...lap 5....openning~!....u-turn...blinker....takes the checkered flag....parking~!

bar 821...small quaint lounge style bar...eclectic..tricky to put a finger on a clear vibe...odd combo crowd.....odd combo drink offerings...beer...wine...and soju.....(only holding beer and wine license..likely..).....servin' up 22 oz. "man beer" for $5 (best bang for the buck).....bottled beer for $4......soju shots for $3.....in the other extreme....servin' up "fem drinks" like the bubblin' lychee mermaid...and various soju cocktails....
author: Hen A.

description:
If it wasn't for the mediocre crowd, the impossible to find street parking, and the fact that this place closes at 12 midnight, I'd hang out here more often. (Because the tasty champagne-themed cocktails are damn cheap--$5!! Just make sure to pay in cash because they don't accept plastic.)
 
Eh, Nopa, you can have your neighborhood bar, this Lower Haighter's not going back.
author: Viv C.

description:
Aight listen:
Strike 1: No hard liquor
Strike 2: Cash Only
Strike 3: Close at 11 (WTH?!?)

It was cute and trendy, I'll give it that. But fundamentally there are some things that make or break a bar; regardless of whether it's a bar inside of a nightclub, inside a Marriott off of 101, a dive bar, a lounge, anything. There are certain mandatory qualities to get me to frequent a bar (or at least want to come there more than once). Closing late is good, but letting my pay for my gin and tonic with plastic is also important.
author: Ross G.

description:
I want to be accepted by this bar.  This bar is like, a cool sweet cute guy, who is friendly enough to me, but I just really want him to think that I'm cool too.  So I put on a special outfit.  Not like, a sexy one, but a cute one that will let him know that I'm a neat girl.  And I try to play it majorly cool, not getting all wasted, but just chillin on my champagne cocktail.  And I don't wanna stay too long, lest I get sloppy, but I will just keep coming back til he recognizes me.  My heart will totally flutter.  And I will feel that I have accomplished something.






Can you tell that I recently turned into a fucking retarded 15 year old girl?  Christ.  Just go to the fucking bar already.  Unless you suck.  Then I will stab you.  Trust.  I just got a new knife.
author: Coco D.

description:
I don't get why people wet themselves for this bar.  It's okay enough and I could see why those in the neighborhod would really like it, but it's just one non-decorated room with corrogated metal walls and little else.  I'm not trying to crap all over 821's parade, but I just think this place is garnering too much hype for what it is.  

Having said all those mean things, I will say that they do have good cocktails (I recall trying something delightful with ginger) and I've never had to stand or sit at the bar for lack of a table.
author: Helen C.

description: Most akward feeling ever here at this bar and might even say the bartender, door man, and even the Caucasians sitting next to me were pretty racist acting. I am Latino and have grown up in this neighborhood and its pretty sad to see these "transplants" come to the area i grew up in and treat me and my friends like were unwanted.  First of all the bartender lady didnt aknowledge the fact that we were standing infront of her for a Good ten Minutes while she was making some drink.  There was no one else waiting to order then this white guy comes in she looks at him says hey what would u like? My gf looks at me and says did she just ignore us for the past now 15 Minutes? My gf had to lean over the bar to ask her what we wanted and just says ok. It gets worst. We go to sit down and next to me this white lady has all her friends purses about 8 inches to my right she looks at me and slowly starts pulling all her purses away from me like i was going to steal her ugly ass crap and then moves even further away from me.  To our left there is a window and.the.door man just keeps constantly looking at us three like were about to rob something...wtf is wrong with these people? Might as well put a sign up no colored people allowed...thats how obious it felt.. Bar 821 u SUCK....and next time im bringing a group of Latinos here just to see if i was just being paranoid...dumb asses ;)
author: Alex R.

description:
Being a rivethead, I am automatically attracted towards anything with a number in the name: Front 242, the 400 Club, Richard 23, 16 Volt, etc. So Bar 821 should be a shoo-in, right?

Well, almost.

Frankly, I don't mind that they don't have a hard alcohol license. Their beer selection, albeit limited, makes up for it in quality. But I did feel underdressed there-- fancy pants and pinstriped shirts looked to be the name of the game. I still got good service and no disrespect, but at a slightly upscale price tag. The smallish space and dimmish lighting makes for a intimatish experience, which is nice, but it's not the kind of place I'd return to by myself.

Maybe that's just the rivethead in me.
author: Paul B.

description:
It's amazing to me how this place maintains an air of modesty about it, considering that my assumptions run wild every time I walk past & see a bunch of drunk folks in well-planned & expensive-looking outfits standing around outside having a smoke (inevitably one of the guys will have a tattoo sleeve & look like a pro-skater out burning his paycheck). 

But when you walk in, it feels like you opened the closet underneath the stairs of your parents house as a kid & discovered there was an honest-to-God cocktail party in there. The bartenders are fast & very friendly, the space is cozy but not cramped, & the dark lighting lets you feel like conversational intimacy is a reasonable concept.

A perfect place to stop in after a nice meal at NOPA or Little Star. And despite my occasional commentary on said two establishments' efforts to fancypants-up the neighborhood (I've got mixed feelings about it), that isn't any kind of statement against Bar 821.
author: Pete J.

description:
Number 16 of my top 100 goals-in-life is to double-fist some strong drink in some southeast asian dive bar.

But thanks to Bar 821's happy hour, I may consider checking this one off.

I mean, how can anyone complain about $3 drinks? 

Thanks Bucky K!

07/25/07 Was back here to celebrate Bucky K's Birthday. Staff was awesome as usual.
author: Kenneth J.

description:
So, to tell the truth, this bar isn't the sort of bar i would normally go to. I was told to meet some girlfriends there before heading over to waziema on a weekday night for happy hour. i knew nothing about it. at first i thought it was going to be an absolute nightmare. what is a non-beer drinker supposed to order at a bar that really only serves beer?? it wasn't until my friend introduced me to a champagne/Guinness specialty drink. and it was...delicious!!!! it was the most amazing combo i have ever experienced. i also had a sip of a friend's drink...another combo--delicious as well. 
I now love this bar.
author: Joanna R.

description:
I LOVE LYCHEE MERMAIDS!!!!!

I love 821. the bartenders are super friendly and it's only 1 block from my house, so i can happily stumble home!
author: butters m.

description:
I met a few people at this place in order to relax after work, and enjoy the inebriated happy hour goodness with good company.

Good Points about this place: 
1) Happy Hour Deal (5pm to 7pm):
     - Mojitos are $3
     - IPA (22 oz) drinks are $3
     - Champagne Cocktails are $3
     - Bonus: they have Sake
2) Good music
3) Very clean
4) Nice atmosphere

Bad Points:
1) Parking sucks
2) Bartenders don't pay attention if you have the need for a refill
3) This place does not have food or hard liquor

Regardless of the above bad points, we had a good time. The IPA is the strongest I've had (ever), and the champagne cocktails are interesting.
author: Darrel D.

description:
One drink two words.

Lychee Mermaid.

Sold and I'll take another for the road.
author: Nancy B.

description:
3 words: Chimay on tap. Yeah it's not a bar bar; it's not a hotel bar; it's not a pick-up bar; not a "every kind of beer imaginable" bar; not a faux punker (funker) bar; not an Oxygen bar; not a lounge bar; not the American Bar Association. It's a little, dank, neighborhood bar that's forced to close at 11pm. Good place to meet a friend. They can't screw up the address..that's for sure. Be warned, you might need to bring your xray vision or a flashlight, I couldn't see squat in this bat cave.

3 duckets for being a neighborhood bar, 1 ducket for "Mr. Manchester" who tends to the clientele with chipper spirits and salutations.  "Cheers Mate!"
author: Johnny C.

description:
I used to live in this neighborhood and never made it in here.Fast forward a few years later a friend and I hit it up after our dinner at NOPA. 

Funny story if you refer to my Hobsons CHoice review,I mention a hot bartender I hope doesn't die when I blow up Hobsons Choice .WELL luckily he won't because now he works at Bar 821! Hi Hot Bartender(joey?).

Enough internet flirting.This place is cool.Its dark and candlelit and nice to sit and talk at. I'd give it five stars if it wasn't just wine and beer and sake because none of those things are really my main jam.BOO
author: Lauren V.

description:
A friendly bar with some nice champagne cocktails. They don't appear to have a full liquor license, so the hardest thing they have is shoju, but they make good use of it.

They are owned by the same group that owns Tsunami and Nihon Whiskey Lounge, but they have really weird hours. When I was there the hey closed at 11. Maybe it is to push you to Tsunami around the corner. :)
author: Jordan M.

description:
After looking for a happy hour bar around work and seeing rave reviews for Bar 821, I had it on my radar for sometime. 

I made plans to meet up with a mate to see a show at the Independent at 9pm. I had separate dinner plans so I arrived at 9:10 a little tipsy after copious amounts of sake at Warakabune only to find out my lazy ass mate is still at home waiting on his harem of mingers to gather and feed him grapes. 

So I wait. and wait..... 45 mins go by and the novelty of the $5 Polaroid dude wears off and no other eccentrics are around to keep me occupied. So I decide on a course of action: drinks.

So the choices at hand were Madrone, Fly bar, coffeeshop, or Bar821.
And i chose wisely. The little dark chic wine bar with only a fledgling little skimp of a sign to signify its existence was A find. 

The staff there were the friendliest in the city. None of that grunting that bar staff all round the city seem to communicate with but sincere, friendly service. 
Going to a bar alone can be intimidating however, Bar 821 was very accommodating and made the experience very amicable.

I sipped my cab and left  to meet up with my friend. Upon leaving the bar I realized that I wasn't pissed at my friend for being an hour late but i was glad that a bar could still be cool and sexy and not fore sake the very virtue that keeps people coming back, a space to socialize without judgment.

Kudos to you, Bar 821 for keeping it real and....for having a tattoo parlor right  next door. hm

I'll leave you with Blink 182, Bar 821.

All the, small things 
True care, truth brings 
I'll take, one lift 
Your ride, best trip

Cheers
author: Tak H.

description:
Super dark & romantic. Specialized glassware & the appropriate beers. Champagne cocktails! It's like a secret spot for smooching a sweety! (I can't stop alliterating today). 
I like drinking
author: B.dot P.

description:
Yeah yeah, I know. Not exactly a *hidden* gem.

What can I say? Good drinks (but no liquor), cheap happy hour, nice vibe, and in my 'hood.
author: Joe D.

description:
Bar 821 is a small neighborhood bar that is good for small groups of maybe 4 to 6 people max. I don't believe that they have a full liquor license, so if you're coming here, you'll either be drinking wine, beer, sake, or soju.

Some of the mixed sake/soju drinks are actually quite good.

I wouldn't go out of my way to come back....but I would if I was in the neighborhood and probably only during happy hour. Happy hour is from 5 to 7 pm....all cocktails and all beers are $3.
author: Lester W.

description:
I recently read a great article about happy hour pub crawling through Divisadero, so on a recent trip through the city, a friend and I decided to hit a few and 821 was one of them.

Bar 821 is a small, dark, but chill bar. GREAT happy hour beers on tap and friendly staff. Did I mention they have Chimay on tap!?! That's good enough for 3 stars right there! They also have Sangria and Sake, but that seems to be par for the course in NOPA these days.

There was a very interesting mix of hipster regulars, 40 somethings, and a few "just got off work and need a drink" 30 somethings. Music wasn't too loud and they were running old Popeye episodes on the tele.

Overall a good experience and would definitely hit it up for happy hour again. Depending on your scene, I imagine it gets pretty crowded as the night progresses. We were in around 6:00pm and it wasn't very crowded at all.
author: Darren M.

description:
This place is really small, but nice. I think it's a great place to start off a night. Plus it's near my 'hood, so bonus points for that.

Drinks are really cheap.  Staff was great.

I would easily recommend this place to friends.
author: Matthew R.

description:
I never even knew this place existed.  I think I have walked by 100 times and never seen it, but I am glad my roommate decided to bring it up late Sunday evening.

So the drink I got came from Sarah S' suggestion, although it did make the bartender whiny because apparently it is hard to make (which is why you won't see it on the menu).  The drink was Guinness+Champagne.  Sounds dreadful on paper, but it was delicious.  In fact, I think it is my new favorite drink... Sorry Bar-man...

There were only 2 negatives.  The fact that the bartender told me he hated me when I asked him to make the Guinness+Champagne, and the fact that last call was at 10:30.

I really think this place would boom if they doubled the prices, dropped it straight in the heart of the Marina, played old kung fu movies on a projector at the back of the lounge, and played woxy.com radio.  But I am happy to have them in my neck of the woods instead.
author: Adam O.

description:
This is a very cute and cozy bar. I could see myself as a regular patron. Well, what bar that I can't see myself as a regular patron anyway? The only disappointment I have, this bar reminds me of my friend's 60 year old grandpa that needs to get tucked in bed by 11pm. Such a clit tease. I meant, the bar. 

Anyway, I came so close to last call, I only ended up getting a beer. Next time, I will arrange my time better and be one of those early birds. I would totally look like an alcoholic. Wait, oh nevermind.
author: Perry S.

description:
I love this place!  I've only come in here on weekdays, but I've always been able to get a comfy spot in the window seats.  The happy hour is awesome and I love their champagne drinks!  The sangria pitcher is larger than it seems & oh-so-delicious.  
I also have to give a big gold star for the Monday night bartender since he has a huge smile, plays what is clearly his favorite music, and is just a great guy to be around.
author: Karyn J.

description:
Everyone's now discovered Bar 821, a small bar/lounge that the locals love even though (or is it because?) (1) they don't serve hard alcohol - their cocktails are made with either champagne or soju, (2) they close early - 10:00 p.m. or 11:00 p.m., (3) it's perfect for starting a night out.

Others have remarked that their wine pricing encourages you to buy a bottle instead of a couple of glasses, and that fits in with their strengths - Bar 821 is a place where you split a bottle of wine (or two) with friends. It's almost half bar, half living room.
author: Timothy O.

description:
Nice place to hang out with a friend or a small group.  They don't serve hard alcohol, but the sake and soju drinks are tasty.  Personally, my preferences lean toward the beer on tap. People watching is pretty great here.  The crowd in general is young and good looking.    

This place has one of my favorite bar bathrooms of all time.  Roomy, clean, has good posters on the walls.  

The only drawback here is that the place closes early.  Maybe 11:30.
author: Nelson W.

description:
Such a Fan!

I chose Bar 821 for my Birthday Party this year. I contacted the staff ahead of time to reserve tables and they were so nice. We arrived early and didn't even need to have the tables reserved because the bar was fairly empty. 

The bartender (I am sad to admit I forget his name) was incredible. He mixed some amazing champagne cocktails... YES.. this was my favorite part. The Champagne cocktails.. and wonderful bottles of wine.. all moderately priced.

The seating is great, I had about 20 friends and we dominated the place, it was so much fun. Everyone else there seemed to enjoy our energy and we felt welcome. I am so incredibly happy I chose Bar 821 for my birthday location, it was a great celebration!

It is a wonderful location, great neighborhood bar, I hope all the wonderful reviews do not cause it to lose its luster! SHINE ON
author: Hailey P.

description:
Happy hour is from 5 - 7pm. $3 Hoegaarden, Lefe, Guiness, Stellas. Anyone who's anybody wears FTC or Huf gear here. If Parkey Posey were alive, this is where she would be reading a magazine while waiting for her Little Star Pizza to get delivered. Sometimes they have "The Wiz" playing on the widescreen perfectly positioned to pay the bills of your chiropractor for the next five years. 

It's quaint. It's quiet. It's intimate. If you plan on goosing, take her here. You won't even need any rohypnol. Use some nice coversation and LISTEN. Don't just talk the whole time. LISTEN. 

It's small and the seating is very low, so don't plan on bringing Chewbacca.
author: San F.

description:
How is it I had not seen this spot before?  Strictly a beer and wine liquor license, they have some fun Champagne Cocktails and Sake cocktails which are fun and good, but won't always be a good substitute for a good old martini.  A decent selection of wines and beer. Cute spot; small, modern, cozy. 

Service was not great. Friendly, but gave us used napkins, so that was not a great start.  (Don't get me wrong - I am all for sustainability and recycling, but if re-using other peoples napkins is the next step, I will happily follow the BYON (bring your own napkin) standard... just let folks know this is the way it's done...

I will be back - with my own napkin. We missed the happy hour specials, but they seem to be something not to miss.
author: Danielle R.

description:
A couple shelves on a wall  ain't a bar, folks.  A bar needs an  edifice of some sorts, especially one that touts itself as a neighborhood bar. No, this place speaks of knowing it will be trendy for it's fifteen minutes and why put money buiding out the place when it's going to be gone in thirty.
It's a square room that serves alcohol.
Low ceilings of metal, concrete floors and speakers that sound like they came out of a 65 Chevy create a Faux Energy,  a loudness that makes it impossible to conversate without screaming.  It's designed like this, to create a sound hysteria, because that's all this place has.  Noise.
Like my father would say "So, what's the attraction here?"
"Dad, I can't see one.  Let's go somewhere else."
author: paul k.

description:
I walked in with my GF (she lives around the corner) and they wouldn't serve us... It was confusing since they seemed to be in the business of selling drinks and ambiance, yet had none.
I'm gonna try some other day when they're not busy ignoring customers.
author: Tom S.

description:
I've been here a number of times during their amazing happy hour (5:30-7 every day!) where I can have myself a 20 oz. Big Daddy IPA for $3.  The bar is relatively calm and relaxing during happy hour and the bartender is nice.  I go to 821 for the atmosphere but would avoid going here during its night hours when drinks are expensive and inside is crowded.

What else can I sat? It's an Intimate, cozy little bar in location you can't beat.
author: Scott G.

description:
I've been thinking about how many stars to give this place since last night after my latest visit to Bar 821.  Finally I settled on 3 stars, but I have fluxuated between wanting to give them 2, all the way up to 4 stars.  

For some reason, this is a place I end up going on Sundays.  The bartender who works Sundays is great.  very nice and friendly.  

The bar is right across from Little Star Pizza on Divis, and it's not uncommon for patrons to order from little star and bring it over to eat, since Bar 821 doesn't serve food.  

I like the decor and it's not crowded. You can actually have a drink and a conversation.  

I have a couple disappointments with this place:  1) they don't serve hard liquor, and 2) both times I've ordered wine here the wine tasted awful.  I recovered from this nicely with a replacement, though.
author: Angie C.

description:
This is one of the coziest bars that I've ever been to. It's small, but the ambiance is warm, inviting and really mellow. The bartenders are very friendly, lovely people. Usually very dark in here so I wouldn't suggest coming here to read or do work. 

The crowd here is mixed, but usually you'll see kind of an arty crowd. Sometimes hipsters, mainly skateboarding graffiti artists.  A lot of couples come here too. They have a super sweet happy hour deal until 7 which is $3.00 champagne cocktails and beer. I personally love the sparkling ginger. The sad thing is, I order it so much that I don't even need to tell the bartender anymore. He basically just starts pouring it when I sit down. I hate that I'm so predictable.
author: Jade L.

description: Bar 821 is the decent spot to have cocktails in a low key, chill atmosphere with a friendly staff.  The place has a small bar, with a few tables an chairs and a bigger couch in the back.  Bar 821 does not have a full bar; they serve beer, wine, and creative champagne and sake drinks.  Although they have specialty drinks, I prefer the tall PBR cans.
author: Sandy K.

description:
Being stuck between two neighborhoods can sometimes be confusing and difficult.

But now I can either roll four blocks down the hill to be hipster-slumming at Place Pigalle or crawl four blocks up the hill to be hipster-hobnobbing at Bar 821. 

And in both cases I won't have to worry about making too much of a fool of myself, cause neither serve liquor.

Life is good.
author: Tatjana G.

description:
You could think of reasons not to like Bar 821: It's small and dark, there's no hard alcohol, and the beers on tap (Hoegaarden, Leffe, etc.) are kind of pricey and there are no budget drinks available. They close early, and there are no pool tables or porn video games.

Think of the intent though; it's not a get smashed and jump on the couches place. It's a meet your neighbors for a drink place, and a get to know each other on a first date place and a relax after work place. You don't drive nails with screwdrivers. 

If you're here for the right reasons you'll appreciate the slick dark decor and the friendly bartenders and the clean restrooms and the TV that's always playing stuff like Dune or Clash of the Titans, You'll sit with your friends or the girl or the guy that you finally asked out and relax the way you're supposed to.
author: matthew r.

description:
$3 for happy hour cocktails is pretty awesome. Unfortunately, they don't have hard booze but then again, it's probably better for my own safety...

I really liked the champagne cocktail with ginger - it wasn't very sweet but had a tiny spicy bite at the end. 

The bartender was super friendly - I was a big fan. 

Good spot to meet some friends for a not-too-loud chat and some cocktails.
author: Alli J.

description:
Sunday night.  Bottle of Pinot Noir.  Thumper of "Bambi" fame on plasma.  Closing down at 11pm in order to get me home for a decent night's sleep before the work week begins (thank you).  Perfect way to end a weekend.

July 10 Update:  I asked the bartender why they closed at 11pm, and they said that it was out of courtesy of their neighbors.  He also mentioned that it gives him the chance to get out to the bars and get laid.
author: Karen C.

description:
Did you know that if you put a raisin into a glass of champagne, it will continually float to the top then sink to the bottom?

You have my permission to impress your friends with that useless fact as you sip champagne at Bar 821. 

I went there for the first time last night, opting for the Silk In Pink (bubbly, cranberry juice and Triple Sec), but enviously eyed the Lychee Mermaid my friend had ordered (the bartender plops a nice lil lychee fruit into your glass! ...from a can. but thoughtful all the same)

These champagne drinks are only 3 bucks if you hit this spot at Happy Hour!
author: Jen O.

description: Awesome local neighborhood type bar, hot bartendress.  Cash only though, so leave the credit card at home...make sure you tip well!
author: Daniel G.

description:
I met a very cute and cool girl here the other night named Carrie/Keri/Cary.  

In the meantime, I'll have another frosty Stella served in the appropriate glassware.
author: J P.

description:
I DESPERATELY want to give you 5 stars, but the acoustics SUCK.  One would think after 3+ years and presumably scores of complaints, something simple (fabric on the ceiling, sound absorbing panels) could be done to address the noise.
Aside from that, the decor rocks, the bartenders are all quite cool [except that Joey described me as a 40-something chick to a mutual friend when I was still only 39 :( ] and the Mojitos are my FAVORITE!!
I'll keep going even though I'm obviously one of their *older* customers.
;)
author: D C.

description:
821 is a chill spot in a chill neighborhood.  Definitely a locals spot, but don't let that scare you away, the locals are all welcoming and friendly.  I can pop in after work when flying solo and wind up chatting with someone.

Great happy hour deals (I don't think people really get that the $3 beer is 22oz, so it's like 2 $1.50 beers in one glass!)  Or Chimay, Stella, Guinness... or soju coctails.  Which are very well made (ginger and lychee just to mention some of the flavors... I mean, when't the last time you had a whole lychee fruit as a garnish?)

Dimly lit, and there is usually an obscure film playing with no sound so thet the bartender's iPod can add a soundtrack to your evening.  I've discovered both new music and new movies from hanging out there.

If you NEED hard booze, you won't find it here, but if soju, wine, bubbles or beer will suffice, and you'd like to meet your neighbors here in the Western Addition... pop on by.
author: Shawn S.

description: I loved the 5-7 happy hour at this self-purported "locals" place -- though it is a far cry from Cheers. Great vibe, awesome fermented liquor martinis. Good music, diverse clientele, all at $3 a drink. Get sloppy drunk at 6 pm here!
author: Andrew K.

description: Cool happy hour spot out on Divisadero that most people probably don't know about. I love the dark, candle lit ambiance and small setting. Very friendly bartender who takes care of guests like the neighborhood bartender. Happy hour specials are well-priced with a great selection of beer. Solid place to start the night.
author: Ed L.

description:
It's around the corner from home, it has good mellow early evening drinking atmosphere, it has a great happy hour, always interesting flicks on the big screen, Joey will play "Goodbye Horses" by Q Lazarus at any time and its a really friendly neighborhoody vibe. 

If you get hungry, order Little Star to go and bring over to eat.

Or if you get drunk enough, get a tattoo next door.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
I love this little NoPa gem...

Bar 821 is a cozy and friendly bar in the North of the Panhandle neighborhood. While I can't get my Vodka & Tonic here, they do have a nice selection of beer, wine, champagne cocktails (very yummy) and sake drinks.

This is a great neighborhood bar where you can come in, be greeted by super friendly bartenders (Juan and Oba rock) and nice folk from the neighborhood.
author: Al B.

description:
Posting rules on your window is just begging for people like me to break them, so I'm sharing the secret that's already well-known -- 821. Seriously, when I saw that on the window as I walked in, I was like, "And, you just earned yourself a Yelp review."

821 has a really good selection of beer and wine, but no hard alcy. I was there on a Wednesday night and it was pretty crowded and loud... but a good scene overall. My one annoyance with this place is that it's cash-only. If I can't open a tab, I'm over it.
author: Heather L.

description:
This place would be a five star establishment if it weren't for their intolerable sound system.  What happened to the bass, or even mid range for that matter? All I hear is screeching highs being blasted through this Play-Skool My-First-Radio.

I've been here twice, the bartender is always cool and the wine delicious.  The seating is modern and comfortable. Please invest in some new speakers!
author: Peter S.

description:
I don't belong here. I don't fit in. I used to fit in here, but I don't anymore. When I come to Bar 821, I always bring my friend who lives in NOPA so that I can fit in. Yes, I'm surprised they still allow me in.

You see, I used to live in this neighborhood, but I've since moved southward. So, according to Bar 821's rules, I don't really belong here. Well, I do, it's just that I have to acquiesce if someone from the 'hood wants to come in and have a seat and my Potrero ass is stealing prime seating space. Or so the rules stated on the wall say.

But I feel so at home here! I love the lighting, the seating, the drinks, the service! Please let me keep coming back.

Joe's so nice and honest about the fact that some of the more expensive wines aren't exactly better than the cheapos. And his Manc accent is like smooth butter to my ears.

I consider myself an honorary Divisaderian just so I can keep coming back to this lovely little bar.
author: Rachel F.

description: I  came here with a couple friends on a rainy Saturday night. It was far from crowded. Just a few people at the bar and the couches were completely empty. We ordered a pitcher of sangria and took a seat on the couches. It seemed like a typical evening until a middle aged Asian man sitting at the bar fell of his bar stool. He then stood up, attempted to sit on the chair again, and fell again, this time slamming his face into the bar. When he stood up his face was covered in blood. Shortly after the paramedics arrived. They attended to the man. In the mean time he tried to drink a candle. Finally the took him away on a stretcher in an ambulance. After that the place cleared out. We finished the pitcher of sangria and were on our way. Interesting experience. Oh the sangria was tasty, but not very strong and there was no fruit floating around.
author: Polina S.

description:
This is very much a door on the side walk that you "happen" to find.  It's dark, warm, cozy and the bar is sake, wine, beer and other non-hard alchohol booze.

A great bar to relax and unwind with a pint or a glass of wine.   It does close early sometimes so it's definitely a "starter" location.

I used to come in here when I lived a few blocks away....

I miss it....*tear*
author: Jay H.

description:
when it comes to bars, i too tend to be overly critical. Maybe it's because i used to work in one.

This place felt right at home to me -- not too many posers or fakes. And just about the right amount of dirty boys in the joint (and me like dirty boys) to check it out once more.
author: Vanessa J.

description:
I'm not much of a fan.  

I like that they are very neighborly, that happy hour drinks are super cheap, and that they have a great selection of wine and beer.

But let's face it, the lack of hard liquor is a huge blow to any bar.  And frankly, I really wasn't feeling the decor, it felt pretty run down in there.  But the real deal breaker for me was the noise level - couldn't really have a conversation with my peoples, which is why I was there in the first place.  Parking also *sucks* in this part of town...
author: Jenny S.

description:
I used to (unfairly) refer to 821 as "the curfew bar" thanks to its 11pm closing time.  

I walk by the place every day on my way home from work, and have, from time to time, stopped in.  It's got a nice selection of brews and a reasonable happy hour.  

Considering that my other local neighborhood bar is Fly, which attracts me like flies to vinegar, Bar 821 fills the bill when I want a beer in a setting more sociable than my couch.
author: Sterling M.

description: I don't really "get" this place.  Nice atmosphere, friendly bartenders, but what's up with shutting down at 11:30 on a Friday night?  And what's up with leaving the door propped open so it's freezing inside?  And what's up with all the hipsters who look like they just invaded from The Mission.  And why limited to beer, wine, and champagne?  I gotta crawl over people at Minibar for a J&C?  Yes, Bar 821 leaves me with some questions I may never discover the answer to - perhaps I'll check it out more than twice and discover the answers, all in good time.
author: John H.

description:
Update AGAIN! 1/28/08:  I have gone back to this bar a few times now and realized it is much more of a date one-on-one kind of place.  Their Happy Hour Rocks.  $3 for beer and specialty drinks is pretty great.  Nice atmosphere and a friendly bartender.  Earned yet another star!

UPDATE 6/16/07:
Went here for a drink while my date and I waited for a table at Tsunami...the champagne drinks are yummy and the bartender was super cool so they earned an extra star.

Previous Review/Experience:
A group of friends and I headed over here after lots of beer and pizza at Little Star...we had never been over there so we thought we would check it out.  It was tiny, dark and moody...kinda made me giggle to see the sign that said "We only serve nice people."  We got all kinds of looks from the people in the bar.  This was NOT a place to go BS with your drunk buddies.  We decided to leave to go to the Page..

One of my friends drunkenly (yes that is a word) said "Let's get out of this fuckin' hipster bar" and a guy smoking outside said, "Fuck you!  Go to the mission!"

We laughed the whole way to The Page.
author: Julie C.

description:
Bar 821 is a great little neighborhood place--I haven't been in awhile b/c my friend who lived in NOPA moved and so now this cool area is no longer my second 'hood.  But when I was hanging out there all the time 821 was a great place to go for a casual drink, either after or before dinner.  Everyone is very friendly and the atmosphere is stylish yet relaxed and unpretentious.

Yes, they close at 11, but somehow that makes the place seem even cooler...
author: Kevin H.

description:
you treated me okay. I will admit, it wasn't so much fun being sneered at by the bartender who under his breathe said 'f***** hipsters' when we approached the bar.

maybe he was a Republican? maybe he didn't like minorities? I dunno. but its a cheap drink and a cheap thrill at this place but next time but they don't have hard liquer which is a bit of a bummer. so it wasn't quite easy for my date to get me drunk and I know she wanted to take advantage of me but you cut her off from letting her buy me another drink. shame on you. I missed out on sex.
author: Derek Alistair J.

description:
We used to call this the "secret bar" b/c we could never figure out what the name.
Great wine list. Dark, small. Alll the things that I like. Yet... there is something that gets me. I think it is the clientel.
Sometimes, I go in - people are cool, calm, having little conversation. Good Vibe.
But then I go in-it's like hipster invasion. And I'm going, " aww crap.. all these people are going to talk really loudly about obscure bands, and cultural shite I have no need to overhear- but it makes them feel smart  and cultured.
I feel edgy around this vibe- like high school lunch room all over.
Okay so maybe the bar has no problem . Maybe it's me...
Maybe I am usuing Yelp as a way to deal with my psychological problems.
Then again-- maybe the bar has a sometimes Douchey crowd.
author: shannon t.

description:
Went to this bar for the first time with a friend for a birthday. She raved about the fact that it was a champagne cocktail place and I would love it. I have to agree with her. 

The only reason I go there now is for the champagne cocktails, and that's it. I love the variety and the price. Their beer and wine selection is a bit lacking for me but again prices are reasonable. It doesn't stay open as late as other bars, so get there at a reasonable hour (It closes at 11). It is definitely more crowded on the weekends. 

Overall it is a chill place where you can hang out, have a drink, and hear the person talking across from you.
author: Diana R.

description:
Great neighborhood spot and yummy champagne cocktails. New favorite:  The Valentine:  champagne with a strawberry and a piece of dark chocolate.  Heaven.  
Don't go with a big group -- best for 2-4 people.  You can order sushi from Tsunami and they'll bring it over which makes it great, but you might as well go early for a drink at 821 and then cruise over to Tsunami to eat.  Or reverse it, eat at Tsunami first and then finish the night at Bar 821.
author: Lija H.

description:
After a previous failed attempt at getting a drink here (it was packed and there were about 6 of us), my boy and I went back last night.  Two champagne cocktails (me) and a Guinness (him) later, we were making out on their surprisingly comfortable bench seats.  

Everyone else has already mentioned this, but the valentine and the lychee mermaid are fabulous.  We didn't drink any wine, but the wine list looked good with some very reasonably priced bottles.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Katie S.

description:
Bar 821 walks the delicate line between bar you could take a date to and bar you could send your snowboarding buddies to -- the former will like the candlelight and the old black and white movies on the flatscreen TV, the latter will like the Avalanches on the ipod stereo, the 22 oz of Anchor Beer, and the lack of pretension despite its attractive decor. Or switch that around, depending on who you bed/board with.

The bartenders are friendly, funny, and ultimately solid; the beers are well-picked; the crowd is a nice mix of locals and folks going to shows at the Independent. If I could change just one thing it would be their doors-at-11 policy, but on nights when I'm not leaving a show down the street, I'm glad to be in the bar and not get the post-concert rush.
author: Trisha W.

description:
I liked it better when it was a secret.  Every time I try to go now it's way too crowded.

I gotta figure out how to get out of work earlier to take advantage of the happy hour Mojitos.  Last time I did this I ran into a friend from back home (WISCONSIN!) and got fairly soused without spending hardly any money.
author: Rachel N.

description:
There's something a little off about a place that's showing sports on a giant plasma TV, all the while cranking Love & Rockets' back catalog, and that's what I love about it.


 Although the decor leans toward the glitzy, chic-Amsterdam-lounge concept, the prices and (lack of) attitude remind you that it's a good local, with plenty of regulars and a nice selection of affordable drinks.


 Sure, it's not incognito anymore, but I still tell my friends to meet me at the secret bar. It's still got the cachet. Longer hours would be great, but then it'd lose the charm of a lock-in, as my London friends would call it. They loved it too, by the way.
author: Omid T.

description:
First off, the place was awesome and there was really only one reason why I gave them 4 stars. The only reason being that they do not accept credit/debit cards. While I don't mind having cash to pay for drinks, I do mind having to pay after each individual drink. I wasn't able to open up a tab ,which would make things a whole lot easier (especially if you're with a group of friends). 

That was my only complaint. The atmosphere was perfect, not too dark and not too bright. Music complimented the place and was not overwhelming. The drink selection was on point and Happy Hour prices are hard to beat. Great place to get away from the large crowds in downtown and easy to get to.
author: Daniel R.

description:
Op! My review of this place disappeared, I know I was one of the firsts because I lived across the street when 821 debuted. Nice little neighborhood bar that just happens to be adjoined to Tsunami and the kind folks that run that joint.
The bartenders have always been fun, easy on the eyes and generous, which is all I can ask for when I'm hanging out being a wino. I'm not much of a fru fru cocktail drinker unless it's something with a real kick, so I've only tried the soju stuff a few times. It's ok though, you can hold onto your tough guy demeanor and kick it with a brew just as easily as you can lounge around with a 'pinky out' cocktail. Go ahead, give it a go!
author: Colleen B.

description:
A group of us checked this out for a pre-dinner cocktail on a Wed. night and it was crowded by 7pm. There are a lot of long tables so smaller parties will have to cozy up with their neighbors. 

The $3 happy hour cannot be beat as concerns bubbly drinks and beer, but prices are quite reasonably anyway.

Lychee and Ginger Champagne drinks we're delish.

For cocktail drinkers, beware Soju only. 

None of us tried the wine..but there looked to be a decent selection.

Low-key atmosphere, great for meeting friends for drinks when you actually want to talk to them instead of posing and people watching.
author: Nikke G.

description:
Small, hip, cozy, intimate.

Super-nice bartender with a subtle Manchester accent. 

Great place for small groups. Can see how it might get WAY crowded at happy hour. Rough 'hood with NO parking, but if you can hoof it over here, it's worth the effort.
author: SfMom O.

description: Cute little place, excellent champagne cocktail list, awesome bartender.
author: Dee I.

description:
It's interesting what happens when a place doesn't have a hard alcohol license -- it makes them get creative with soju and sake and come up with things like soju mojitos and a drink I didn't get the name for, which was a shot of soju dropped into a half-pint of champagne.   The staff in general seem like they enjoy what they're doing, which always makes it a better experience overall.

I didn't venture into any of the funky soju cocktails, sake, or the wine list.  My attention was caught by the belgian white ales -- Leffe, Hoegaarden, and Chimay White.  The selection of beer isn't very wide beyond those Stella, and Big Daddy IPA, but there are plenty of other drink choices.

The space is kinda small for the Friday night crowd, so don't roll in with a big group and expect to sit down anytime soon, but the population is friendly.
author: Jay M.

description:
Love it! If I had the resources to open and operate my own neighborhood bar here in SF, this is the place that I'd want! The space is not too small and not too  big; quoting Goldie Locks "it's just right" 
Creative cocktail menu, wine & beer...
author: Mariel C.

description:
One star for the cool bar.

One star for the cool table set up and general ambiance.

One star for the decent music.

One star for the various fancy champagne concoctions.

Minus on star for the serious lack of vodka.  Or any other REAL alcohol.  There's only so much champage a girl can drink and beer is absolutely out of the question.
author: LeSLiE W.

description:
Interesting little place.  I was meeting my date there and I arrived promptly at 6p, but no one else was there.  Including myself, my date, and the bartender, there were 5 people there at 6p.  Shortly thereafter, the rest of the crowd entered.  Then the lights went down to create a "mood".  I wasn't too fond of that (I guess I like to see the person sitting across from me.)  The wine selection is a touch sparse, but their beers are good.  They have a pretty lengthy soju cocktail menu, but I don't drink those.  I have a thing against mixing soju with anything.  Just drink it straight up.  Sadly, none of their wines are discounted for happy hour.  

Anyhoo, the best date in a very long time began here and continued on to Nopa down the street.
author: Alison N.

description:
This is our go-to neighborhood bar. Happy hour is where it's at, massive pints of Anchor Steam for $3...can't go wrong with that. They have some interesting champagne cocktails too.

Sexy atmosphere, attractive patrons, a sprinkling of hipsters, and good times all around.
author: Kara S.

description: This bar is owned by the same peeps who run Nihon Whiskey Lounge, so I had to try it. They don't serve hard liquor, but have a fun little happy hour for beer/wine and some yummy sake and champagne cocktails. They aren't quite as complex as those of Cantina (near union square), but they're good. Nearby, you'll find minibar (looks cute - want to try it) and Little Star (gotta love it). Not too shabby!
author: Sarah T.

description:
I'm glad I live about six blocks away from this place because its slowly becoming my neighborhood watering hole. I really like the smallness of this place combined with the fact that the drinks are really reasonably priced. The bubbly cocktails are excellent (I really like the one with chocolate and a strawberry) and the beers run on the large size ($4 will get you a 22oz Anchor). The lighting and the space is really cool, its easy to forget that other people are here and focus on your conversation with the people around you; its that kind of place. Its true they close early but look on the bright side, it might help you drink less! Great little neighborhood place.

On another note, regarding the whole exclusivity of this place I think its something you just kind of have to laugh off at this point since they are so popular. For this reason, however, my friends and I all refer to this place as "the fight club bar." First rule of 821, you do not talk about 821.

Minus one star because last call is at 11.30 since they close at 12.
author: Nicholas B.

description:
I don't come to this bar very often, but feel like it would be a great place for a first date.  They don't serve liquor, so you don't have to worry about your date polishing of a bottle of Jameson's and throwing up on your new shirt...  The lighting is dim, the chairs are comfy, and setting feels pretty intimate.  

Decent selection of wine, beer, and champagne cocktails.  

Because it closes at 11, you can invite said date over to your place for "one last cocktail" and it still be early enough for her not to say "well, it's already kinda late...."
author: matt c.

description:
Great little neighborhood spot with a unique feel.
  - Quiet enough to talk without being a crypt.
  - Hip enough to be fun without being self absorbed.
  - But for the liquor...
author: Stefan A.

description:
This place had no sign when I moved to the neighborhood seven years ago.  A secret little hole in the wall pub that closed up, neighborhood peeps only, at 11pm.  I liked that, kind of makes you feel cool and special.  

It does get really loud in there when it fills up, and there's a big ass TV right behind the bar, glaring you in the face, but the bartenders have always been personable, and know how to pour a Guinness.

Why the hell am I reviewing this place?  It's supposed to discreet.
author: Lee P.

description:
For someone like me who finds joy in comparing beer fluid ounces per dollar spent, this is a great find with a good atmosphere.

They have a 5-7pm happy hour every day with a selection of 20 oz. beers (not like the average bar which gives you a "pint" of 12 oz.) and mixed soju drinks for only $3! And the selection ranges beyond normal imports and domestics. The atmosphere was lounge-y and a great place to go on Sunday because it was not crowded, but still vibrant. Overall, had a fun and relaxing experience. 

Next time: will try a weeknight happy hour and the luxury mojito.
author: Jacob and Brianne H.

description: This bar makes me sad. It had such a wonderful past life that it's hard to see it neglected the way it has been. I am not saying it needs to be revamped with "reclaimed" wood or whatever current design cue is in, but it needs owners that actually give a shit. It could be such a cozy, warm, neighborhood bar if the right people were involved. Oh, wait once upon a time it was ;) The only thing standing in it's way (much like Wazima) is the owners. Sell the place and move on to another Whiskey/cigar bar, fellas! There are those of us who still love this place.
author: Honest T.

description: Great happy hour spot. Relaxed ambiance, easy access to good restaurants. Seems to be a hang-out for neighborhood locals.
author: Shweta V.

description:
whats up with those fucking chairs yo? if you lean the wrong way a bit too much, they will tilt over. i wasnt even drunk and i almost fell over. jesus osha fuck me dangerous. 



ok, i was kinda buzzed.





ok, fine i had no shirt on, was butt drunk and i fell out the fucking chair. 

so fucking sue me. 


cool, cheap happy hour joint. good drinks. cant complain. 

except those fucking chairs!!!
author: Euge L.

description: What a cool little neighborhood bar.  They have $3 Hoegaarden beer till 7pm.
author: HY L.

description:
The drinkers of Divisadero and Lower Haight need to get together and protest or something. I mean, this city has protests about everything every other week. We don't like cars so we fuck up the last Friday of the month for every single person who works downtown and just wants to go home and clean up and go out with their friends by not allowing them to get home, even when they are taking public transportation. We don't like plastic bags so we have now outlawed those. We don't like the war and at least once a week we make that known with some protest. That is cool, I am all for getting out on a Friday at 10pm, carrying my 40 in a brown paper bag (as it should be) and lets face it, a war would really put a damper on my Friday plans. So, if we can take the time to speak up about these things why cant we let the people of these neighborhoods know that we want a few more bars that serve hard alcohol!! I mean, I am unsure that serving beer and wine is going to save us from anyone who wants to be drunk and unruly. Newsflash, they can still get drunk and unruly on beer, I swear, and if the liquor store on the corner carries Jack you are not keeping it from them prohibition style or anything. You can serve alcohol in a lower proof form in a bar, out of anything you want, to people on bikes who hate war, but if they drink and want to get drunk they will!!! Can we please have some bars that afford us the luxury of doing this on our own terms!!??

Bar 821, its not your fault. You work with that permit well. You have a good selection of wines by the glass and bottle, and tasty beers and sparkly and soju all at very fair prices for a wine bar. You do your best to provide a nice selection of alcohol "lite" in a dark, loungy, inviting way, but damnit, sometimes I just want a sapphire and tonic. However, when I do have a hankering for some wine while in your neck of the woods you are my first choice.

Anyone up for a protest, or at least a glass of wine?
author: Drue C.

description:
Yummy cocktails, Yummy bartender and regulars, and Yummy Yelpers??? Get out the crayons and color me Tickled Pink!  Those soju bombs were out of this world and somehow matt r and I didn't find ourselves roaming the streets of SF at 5 a.m. after this soju experience!  Nice job, Bar 821!
 Call me Bubbles, I LOVE sparkling wine! The champagne cocktails at Bar 821 can't be beat and they're cheap cheap cheap too! The Ginger Sparkler is now my very favorite champagne cocktail ever. With so much AWESOME going on within these walls, you can bet I'll be showing my face around these here parts a hell of a lot more often now. JAMES (Thanks, G!)  the bartender is adorable and super friendly and like I said, there are some pretty hot hotty regulars, too. 
 Little Star is right across the street and I hear they'll let you bring in food from outside so you can get your drink AND your eat on. The inside is cute and neighborhood-bar-ish. Nice bathroom with cool mirrors. If you live in the neighborhood, I highly recommend!
author: Autumn K.

description: i had a gathering here for my birthday and had an amazing time.  the bartender, juan manuel, was really nice and attentive and i ended up having a party of about 15 people, give or take, at the bar throughout the night.  it's not a really huge place either.  he was really great to accommodate us the way he did -- he brought us fresh wine glasses when new guests arrived and he was very cordial with everyone.  his service was excellent and he even gave us some free passes to a place up the street as we prepared to relocate (after most of the night, really... merely for change of scenery and so my boyfriend and i could save a little money - we bought quite a few bottles).  it was a great night overall, and this place made the perfect setting.
author: Beccie F.

description: A cool little bar to be happy at between the hours of 5 and 7pm every day! $3 soju and sake mojitos, martini and champagne cocktails (the Lychee Mermaid is yummy!) and beers guarantee you will be happily buzzed before getting dinner at NOPA down the street.
author: Connie C.

description:
people, place and product.  fives all around my friend.

821 has become one of my new fav happy hour spots courtesy of joey and james laid-back and entertaining tendering.  mostly a hoodie spot- thanks for the intel AKA G!  

hunttterrrrexxxxx!  we thug hhwwatt!! 
http://static.px.yelp.com/photo/8hrcHKRSwcFHXZ_JF3lvKw/l

i have enjoyed classics on their flatscreen like transformers and thrashin along with a good ole butt-whippin' of the warriors ;-)  little star is right across the street and its all good to bring em over...just be courteous and ask first.

3bucks will get you whatevas from 5-7...and yes i am talking about more than drinks..quick and dirty- hey can't hate on being efficient.
i usually rock a guinness or hoegarrden & on occasion that ginger soju/champagne...order a diamond and risk getting jumped.

for real street cred just keep slurpin up the ABC!
author: omar b.

description:
Charged with not being very prolific lately - I admit my guilt.  Realizing that I have never reviewed Bar 821, even though I love it so?  Surely that deserves a 20 year sentence.  Or maybe just a 20 drink sentence.
Bar 821 started off as my go to spot to wait for my table at Tsunami to open up.  My first trip to both places was on a lovely date - he chose well, and while the dates fizzled shortly thereafter, my love affair with 821 was just beginning.  How can you not love that Tsunami will call you at Bar 821?  Or that you can ask the bartender to call Tsunami to see if your table is ready?  Either way, it works out great.  The champagne cocktails are yummy, the selection of beer is fab, the happy hour is wicked cool, it's small, I usually like the crowd, there are cute bear sized puppies roaming around, and the bartender has an English accent.  WHAT IS NOT TO LOVE?!  I just don't get a hankering for hard alcohol before I come here, and I'm beyond satisfied.  That 20 drink sentence is more a reward than anything else.  Minus a star for not being open at all hours and making me get off my comfy booth earlier than I'd like sometimes.
author: Jennifer D.

description: LOVE the champagne drinks :) tasty and not too expensive. Great layout, decent location, and good crowd. Perfect for groups of people - especially for a night out w/ the girls :)
author: linda t.

description: Sorry for contributing to your unwanted exposure to the internet masses, Bar 821, but I just *had* to Yelp about this place.  Once in a great while, I happen upon a night spot or restaurant that just hits me exactly the right way and this place is it.  Its small, humble, unobtrusive, populated by locals and has a very warm and intimate feel to it.  The bartender is the owner, and his menu is filled with awesome and inexpensive saki and soju drinks (beer and wine license only).  The little decor touches are great, including the colored tile crossbeams on the ceiling.  I think this might be my new neighborhood bar....
author: Rick H.

description:
Making your way in the world today takes everything you've got.
Taking a break from all your worries, sure would help a lot.
Wouldn't you like to get away?
Sometimes you want to go where everybody knows your name,
And they're always glad you came. 
You wanna be where you can see, our troubles are all the same.
You wanna be where everybody knows your name. 
You wanna go where people know, people are all the same,
You wanna go where everybody knows your name.

OK....so maybe not my name.  Met up with a fellow yelper and they might have well been singing this song.  He knew everyone!   I don't know if the personalities in this bar would have been able to rock it out like Sam and Woody, but this place for sure has character, personality, comfort and a cool quality where you hope they eventually do learn your name. Great happy hour prices, and it closes at 11 on weeknights.  That's a great way to prevent the 2am evening when you have to wake up for work the following day.  Last call...10:50, perfect.   I don't see this being a weekend destination for me, Ill probably hang onto it for beer filled afternoons.  I have lived up the street from this bar for 2 years now, and stepped foot into it for the first time yesterday! I couldn't believe it!  They welcomed me and my pooch and i can see this definitely becoming a regular thing.  Take dog for walk.  Stop in bar with dog.  Have a few beers.  Make rest of walk that much more entertaining.  Thanks for being there 821!  Sorry I haven't gotten to know ya sooner!
author: Lauren F.

description: Great date place! Inexpensive and delicious champagne cocktails! (My favorite is the Lychee Mermaid; and if you want a manly champagne cocktail, there's always the one with Guinness in it.) Very sleek and cozy (although the flat screen TV is an odd touch). It can feel pretty couplely sometimes, and it's definitely not the place to go if you're looking to pick someone up. But that's part of the charm.
author: Leigh M.

description:
i'd give it 5 stars if i was ever able to snag a seat while there.

otherwise, the champagne cocktails are fab and the bartenders are always uber-pleasant.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Something wonderful happened to me this weekend.

...The bar was dimly lit, champagne drinks were very tasty and not cloyingly sweet, drunk dude with butt-crack peeking out was thankfully not hairy, the crowd was very friendly.  All in all, a very nice, laid-back atmosphere to catch up with friends and drink the workweek away.
Sitting at this intimately-lit bar, talking animatedly about my chaotic week of deciphering financial data at work, my girlfriends were intently listening when I suddenly started to cough.  Out of nowhere, a glass of water magically appears at my elbow.  But alas, it wasn't magic!  It was the bartender, thoughtfully placing the cough-saving glass of water by my side without me asking for it!  Without my girlfriends asking for it!  Without me gasping for air, sliding off the bar stool, hysterically pointing at my red face with the international sign of "Help me, I'm choking" kind.  
He gave me the glass of water simply because he cared.  What a concept!
In my years of happy hour'ing and my years of coughing, I have never once encountered a bartender who gives a glass of water out of the goodness of his heart.  In fact when I ask for a glass of water, I've encountered exasperated bartenders, rolling eyes bartenders, dude I'm busy bartenders, but never once a thoughtful water-giver.  
Thanks Joey.  You've given this lady renewed hope.  Thoughtfulness is still alive and kicking.
author: Janice N.

description:
i went here one night and don't remember a thing.

photographs from the night reveal: one of my friends flashing lots of money. over and over. and over. and over. me posing with everyone, include people i am pretty sure don't even exist. lots of thumbs and blurs. mike unzipping his pants. five people fallen over on the sidewalk outside. me being one of them.

good lord.
author: Irene S.

description:
sorry to be a total B but this bar does not need to exist.  the bartender was EXTREMELY rude and standoffish....and he was wearing shorts.  bartenders, or servers of any kind, SHOULD NOT WEAR SHORTS.

oh yea - this monstrosity of a bar charges 10$ for SHOJU cocktails.  shoju.  yea.
author: Brooke M.

description: I like the concept of this neighborhood spot but it just doesn't get pulled off very well.  The beers they offer are good but typical of any semi-hip beer/wine bar these days.  While the seating area is nice it just feels like it is trying too hard.  Also, the place in small... feels like you are intruding even if there are just a few people hanging out there.
author: Thadd L.

description: This place is the epitomy of a local neighborhood-bar. The clientele are low-key, the location is superb, and best of all the selection of on-tap beers!! Hoegaarden and Stella, my two favorite beers. This is definitely a place where I can rely on to be as warm and comforting as a bar should be. Great place for a first date, or just to hang out with the guys/girls. Great selection of cocktails and happy hour is great. I definitely suggest 821 if you are in the neigborhood. They don't serve hard liquor, so if that is your thing, go somewhere else. But who needs to get drunk every time they visit a bar? Especially one right around the corner? Just go there after work, or whatever you do during the day, and unwind with that special one, or whomever. This place won't let you down.
author: Ruchita P.

description: I'm impressed by any place that manages to look like a club and act like a bar. Bar 821, is one of those rare spots in the city that doesn't treat their mixed drinks as means to make up their substantially expensive rent payment. Meaning, they make a mean drink for little, well not a lot. It has the SOMA atmosphere, without the crowd and attention to loud music. The place had a distinctive air of cool matched only by their mixologists. Keep an eye out for their specials, last time we went all champagne cocktails were only $6 for the whole night. You won't see veuve (this isn't SOMA), but do expect fresh squeezed juices splashed inside your bubbles.
author: Michelle K.

description: I've been called out on more than one occasion as to my gravitation towards good deals. This night was no exception. Upon entering the bar, i glanced at the taps and just ordered a Hoegarden. However, a few minutes later I took a look at the menu and noticed a few beers that were $1 cheaper and contained almost double the liquid. Thus, I ordered a 22 oz draft Anchor Steam and all was right in the world...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I have been stopping by here for happy hour for awhile. Since I have so many friends in alamo square, this is generally where we meet. Soju cockails are delicious and they have Guiness. However, not excited about their wine list but hey I am just a wine snob.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Tiny, very dark, limited drink menu, charming, intimate, friendly bartenders, 1st-23rd date location-able, cool crowd, cozy, lazy review writer
author: Jason S.

description: While sometimes it's too crowded in here to get a seat with friends, I do like the fact that it's just a simple local bar. I may miss my whiskey, but Joey knows what's up and always makes sure to take care of me. Yeah, it sucks that it closes at 11, but there's 3 other bars within walking distance that will be open for your drinking pleasure. Hit up 821 first for a bit of relaxin' and then go get your party on.
author: Emily L.

description:
The champagne cocktails alone could keep me locked in my seat for hours; there are several different options and all sound delicious. I tried at least four of them, and I'm still left with  some options to select from on next visit. Honestly,  the only drink I really remember was the lychee cocktail, which was great. 
They have a nice selection of wine to choose from as well and on my first visit the bartender was helpful and friendly in helping my friends and I select a Cabernet. On my second visit, the one in which I tried the champagne cocktails, I wasn't crazy about the bartender. I'm going to cut him some slack though, since it was St. Patrick's Day and he was the only one behind the bar. 
Overall, I enjoy this bar, and it's a place I will go again. 
It should be noted, that this bar doesn't serve hard liquor, but the  selection of soju cocktails, wine, and champagne is enough to keep me content.
author: Natalie M.

description:
freakin awesome!

the bartender, grateful that i stayed even though i had to use the ATM, gave me a free hot sake with ginger. delicious. i liked the ambiance, dark and romantic. the music was pleasant too: mellow but with lots of variety, not too noisy or intrusive. i am going to find excuses keep taking my friends to this place. also great happy hour: $3 drafts
author: Jessica M.

description: 821 is still a neighborhood bar.  The best thing that could have happened was the removal of the rules.  If you see them taking it to the face, with eye balls and teeth, you probably witnessed your first ABC!  They close at 11pm, most days, which doesn't seem to be a problem with folks from the neighborhood.  I can see it being a problem with people looking for a place to chill till 2am on a Saturday.  If you still want to hangout after 11pm, head over to the FLY Bar!  Just as great.  Yet louder.
author: Jamal G.

description: You know what, this is a great bar.  It's just a funky little place that pours some great beer and wine.  There is no booze.  Deal with it.  It closes early.  Deal with it.  It's a great place to just kick back with friends or get a pre-Little Star drink.  I wish I lived just a little closer.
author: Blake W.

description: This bar bills itself as a " neighborhood bar " but when I cruise by on my way to the video store, I don't see anyone I recognize. According to their posted "rules" neighbors will be seated and served first - how do they know who's who? Do they have would-be patrons bring their utility bills with them? I think not. I say marketing, what do you say? Anyway, I think it is just another attempt to gentrify the panhandle. Kinda makes me sick to my stomach.
author: sockanooni s.

description: I would like this place if I didn't get a 15 minute lecture from the bartender on how it is rude to try and buy another happy hour drink before you completely finish the one you are drinking.  Especially since that's less time than it takes for him to actually make your drink.  Not because he's particularly slow at making drinks...more like he just wants you to know that he's got much better things to do while he's bartending.   Otherwise, the drinks are good and the atmosphere is pretty nice.
author: Jackie A.

description: A great place for a quiet chat.  Closes early.  Really nice bartenders.  Good sangria if  you're into sangria (I usually don't order sangria at bars because it tends to be terrible-- old wine with some fruit thrown in to mask the vinegar taste, or even if it's made fresh, it's left exposed to air.)  This bar tends to be mostly locals since it's kind of hidden.
author: Neil G.
