description: Love this place and their champagne cocktails.  Was even cooler when only the locals knew about it, but if you eat at Tsunami you know about Bar 821.  They have cool happy hour specials and an overall cool vibe but I wish they stayed open later.
author: Jill D.

description: Secret bar...that's what I call it.  Hardly noticeable on divis.  This is truly a great neighborhood bar and my favorite neighborhood bar.  Beer, wine, sake and soju only, but a great selection.  Joey, the bartender is super nice and friendly.  Who needs hard liqueur when I can barely stumble home from too much Chimay...
author: Susan P.

description: I love the bartenders.  The Mojitos knock me out every time. Its such a relief from the chaos of Fly Bar. Pretty relaxing and a great place to meet with some friends without having to shout.
author: Nicole C.

description: The bartender (Tonya, I think) was so sweet, it was as if I were an actual paying customer.  What makes this place great is that you would never know it's there until you have been there.  It's in a great location right at Fulton and Divis, and yet it sits behind a non-obtrusive door.  It's clean, low key and has a "locals only" feel.
author: regina k.

description: I was really really wanting (needing!) a whiskey. All they had was beer and sake. Normally I love beer, but I had way too much beer that week. The sangria just didn't do it for me. The jalapeno sake was very interesting, but when a girl needs a stiffy, a girl needs a stiffy. I was dissatisfied. But the place is cute as hell, the music was cool, and it was pretty much empty on a Tuesday night, so I'm keeping this place in pocket for a local joint to have a non-whiskey drink on a weeknight.
author: Stumbalina b.

description:
yea. im drunk. and its because of this place. but you know what? im not mad. this place is great. they got me real drunk for real cheap and its not even 9 yet. yea you should go here. and i dont know what else to say, but i'll write more when im sober. omg i walked so much. ok im drunk im going to sleep.

ok im editing. because i'm still drunk. and its not 9 and i'm not asleep. i walked into this place and thought pshhhhhh soju!? i'm korean biyatch. i can drink that shit. but i should have listened to the bartender. he was right. there is no such thing as JUST a mojito. omg i'm totally going to delete this in the morning. 

:: edit ::

ok so it's 3:37 am and i swear i'm sober now. reading what i wrote before makes me think i'm not that bad of a drunk, but then i realized why am i writing a review drunk before i pass out at 9pm? 

anyways, so their happy hour rocks. but those drinks are sneaky. you think that they're "weak sauce" bc theres no hard liquor except soju but they mix them so well that you unknowingly inhale the drink. I think things started going downhill for me when i ordered the "Valentine" simply because I wanted chocolate and it has a piece of chocolate in it. so there i was trying to get the piece of chocolate that was going UP AND DOWN AND UP AND DOWN AND UP AND DOWN in the champagne. I finally got it but that was after chugging the champagne and swallowing the raspberry whole. but the moral of the story is, i got the chocolate.

i dont know what to say about the clientele, i was too wrapped up in my best friends who were visiting, but they were all friendly. i think.

the place is very clean and nice and the bathroom is fine as well. i remember wishing htey had more than just one unisex bathroom though.

so it's 7 o'clock and i realize that i'm drunk and that i can only maintain my facade of tipsiness for so long before I start acting a fool so i whisper to my friend "jo, i need to get out of here i think everyone is noticing the little drunk asian girl in the corner" and she laughs at me and orders another drink. and i said cool. so finally we decide to leave and as we stumble outside we are blinded by the sunlight and all the way home we just kept wondering how we got so drunk so early and I was about to explain to them the process by which alcohol enters our digestive system and then to the blood stream and in the process reveal the cure for cancer, but i thought that it'd be better to just suggest gettin a burrito on the way.  

all in all we had an awesome time, nextime maybe i will pace myself better so i can make it past happy hour.
author: Lillian P.

description: I love this place! The drinks are great and unique. I had the Tropical Mist, has Sake mixed in, which was sooo tasty and a little bit of a creeper. Nice spot to lounge and wasn't too crowded for a Saturday night. I will be back. =)
author: H. A.

description:
i read all of the other reviews of this place before trying it out, so i had heard about their strange attempt to be a "neighborhood bar."  yes, there is a sign indicating something about seating privileges for "locals" and i guess the hours are... different, for an establishment slinging drinks.  i was a bit wary.  

however, i ventured in last week and was pleasantly surprised.  it was a weeknight, so not crowded at all, and the ambiance was lovely.  dimly lit but not completely dark, and warm tones used in all of the decor.  The bartender was extremely nice, and the other patrons were of the low-key, non-scenester variety.  i loved it.  

the wine list was small but definitely sufficient, and the MOCKtails were actually really nice, if a little froofroo for my taste.  i am extremely suspicious of soju concoctions, but i was impressed with the sour apple mojito.  it was too sweet for me to want more than a sip or two, but that isn't my style anyway, so i give it a thumbs up.  

two really random observations:
- there only seems to be one bathroom and the glass door is not completely opaque.  no one was waiting outside while i was using it, but i had to wonder if the user would be giving the line-waiters a shadow show on busier nights?
- the cocktail tables are bolted to the floor.  i was appreciative, as it meant that i was unable to knock over our table or spill drinks with some excessive leg crossing.  however, if i had a larger group, it would have been a bit challenging to figure out how to sit at these tables and have a conversation together.  i recommend coming with a friend, on a date, or with just one or two other people.
author: Kirsten F.

description: Great little spot to grab a couple of drinks, a cozy little corner table, and sit and talk for awhile.  The music selection is interesting, eclectic and unobtrusive.  Fun people-watching spot.  This is one of the few bars I have been to where you can have a conversation with the person sitting next to you and actually hear 100% of what's being said. Rare for a bar, and definitely lands this place on my short list of bars I would love to go back to.
author: Becca V.

description: HELLO happy hour! Seven days a week and awesome music and a fun bartender with just enough attitude to keep it interesting. They also don't care if you cruise in with a Little Star Pizza and pig out with your champagne cocktails. I am quite happy it's close by my house.
author: Whit P.

description: Small, dark and AWESOME!  It's the perfect neighborhood bar atmosphere.  They don't serve the hard stuff, but I still like it anyway.  The bartenders are really nice and the ambiance is great for a date.
author: Corey V.

description: Shhh, it's supposed to be a secret! Granted, it still pretty much IS a secret- generally populated by neighbors (myself included) - a solid wine list, a decent beer selection, and some seriously slinky comfy seats to get cozy in while listening to Joey or James' awesome tunes.
author: teriaki b.

description:
How I feel about 821....

- I'm new to the hood and Bar 821 has quickly become our go-to for an unpretentious drink. 
- I feel like I could show up in a hoodie or a dress and fit right in. 
- They only have beer and Soju, but the upside to that is that the prices are very affordable and they put effort into crafting some cool cocktails. 
- They have a killer $3 happy hour from 3 - 6 (every day I think). 
-  friendly bartenders
- cool modern but casual decor
-  I've heard you can bring in take out (Little Start is down the street)

Try the "signature spicy" cocktail that's no longer on the menu. It's made with infused Habanero Soju.
author: Sarah G.

description: Close to my apt,  Great happy hour prices, Entertaining bartender (joey), and they make a Litchee mermaid cocktail. Litchee and champagne. mmmhmmm.
author: Karlee D.

description: A really great little spot: Perfect for after work, before dinner or going out for the night. The champagne cocktails are great, and the prices for a bottle of wine are very good. I love this place for a girls' night out, but I think it'd also be a great spot for a drink with a date. The atmosphere is really nice, and the staff is very friendly too.
author: Barbs J.

description: I finally found a bar in SF that is perfect.  No I don't miss the hard liquor, no I don't care it closes at 11PM.  Hard liquor gives me a hangover and most nights I would just rather go to bed by midnight.  But this place is perfection.  The lighting is dim, the furniture is comfortable, its not super crowded but the crowd is cool, the bartender was nice, and the drinks are my cup of tea.  I love the Champagne drinks for $5!  My favorite so far is the one with cranberry and triple sec.  For some reason it tastes like Zima which I have to say I was the queen of drinking in high school and brings back great memories.
author: Lindsay P.

description:
I read a bunch of reviews about Bar 821 on yelp, and one of the things that i thought was really weird about it was their door policy. they dont let anyone in after 11pm. hmmm, sounds like kind of an interesting gimmick to stop letting people in after a certain point and have a private party inside for the rest of the night. sure, a bit odd, but i thought it could be interesting. we headed down there and showed up at the place at 10:45pm. as we walked through the door, the bartender glanced up and shook his head at us. nope, we wouldnt be getting any drinks tonight.

it turns out that we misunderstood... they dont just stop letting peole in after 11... they shut the bar down. so, it's only 11pm and we're outta luck with no other new bars anywhere near by. what kind of bar shuts down at 11?? is it past people's bedtimes or something? also, it's lame enough that they close at 11, but why not at least serve drinks right up until closing?? the reason bars usually stop serving early is because they dont want to break the law and have people still drinking at 2am... but if your bar closes at 11pm, there's no legal reason to have a"last call". also, they have a rule where they give "locals" preference. what does that really mean? do they check your address on your drivers license and then make non-locals give up their seats?? basically, i think these guys just wanted to have something quirky and interesting about their bar, but instead their rules are just kind of lame.

(my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: http://fiftybars.thisisvlad.com )
author: vlad k.

description: Ok, so now my new favorite place, even though I was only here for 30 minutes. Great neighborhoody bar -  no Bridge and Tunnelers, no rowdy drunks. It's a nice, mellow, dark lounge - great to kick back  with a glass of vino. I'll be back again and again and again.
author: Jen R.

description: F the naysayers. This place is what it is... a great place to meet a friend and grab a $3 sake-jito before grabbing dinner around the neighborhood. It's a place where you can talk (and hear each other), where the bartender is friendly, where the lights are dim and where people who don't like it -- shouldn't go.
author: C'est La V.

description: It's in an awesome location, and the champagne concoctions are fun, but that's about it. I went on a Tuesday night and they kicked us out before 10:00! Wtf? What kind of bar closes that early? Also, no liquor license = no booze. Walk the extra block and hit up Fly Bar or Madrone.
author: Valerie N.

description: Happy hour-$3 for all of their drinks except the ones marked by an asterisk.  I got the mojito (made with soju, not rum) normally $8 for $3.  Honestly that's about all it was worth.  It wasn't very good, tasted nothing like a mojito, but it was strong.  I tried another drink that was much better, something with grapefruit juice.  Really liked the atmosphere and mix of people.  Perfect happy hour spot.
author: Sarah M.

description: This place is the perfect neighborhood bar... a few of us went for happy hour and loved it.  Nice decor, cozy vibe, unpretentious... what's not to love?  The whole concept of nigori sake in a cocktail with mint is a bit vile, though.  I may stick with the champagne-only or soju-only cocktails, or the beers from now on.
author: Godot -.

description: This place is amazing.  Happy hour rules and it's 7 days a week.  Bartenders are really awesome.  Try the Luxury Mojito (a soju-sake cocktail); it's delicious, and during happy hour it's just $3!
author: Meagan C.

description: Just the spot after work.  Closes at 11 on weekdays so expect to move on.  Service is great, just wait your turn.  For anyone who says that they are "neighbors" but don't recognize anyone, I just want to ask you where you hang out.  This place is like my living room, and I can see many of my neighbors whenever I go in.  Sometimes a bit too loud, but it is a bar.  Also, for those who complain about the hours, remember that it is a residential area, and the roof of 821 is the floor of an apartment. Respect given to the business owners for recognizing this and respecting the tenants by having shorter hours.
author: Jayson J.

description: I love champagne cocktails! They make me feel like a classy hooker. If only for a moment. Sigh.
author: D e v a n.

description: 5 stars based on only one visit, mostly because I am so damn grateful to have found this sweet space in my otherwise quiet neighborhood. The space, lighting, wine selection, Guiness, patrons, bartender--all great. I can't wait to roll on down there again soon. (And I happened to notice that Everlast tattoo, right next door to 821, was open last night, so maybe next time you see me at a Yelp event I'll have Bar 821 tattooed on my forehead!)
author: Gretchen T.

description: Stopped by here for a nightcap after dinner at Nopa tonight and this place is WAY better than it once was.  The new bartender, Juan, is really friendly and on top of his game when it comes to pouring drinks.  On top if this, his music selection was WAY better than the typical whiny indie crap that I remember playing here.  It wasn't crowded at all, and if this place wasn't required to close at 11 I'd probably give them 5 stars.  MUCH needed improvement here.
author: Joshua W.

description: Let me start off by admitting that I'm biased towards Bar 821 because it's three blocks from my place. But that aside, this place is really chill for some tasty, cheap pints. Many a pint of Speakeasy has been downed by yours truly here, and the ambience inside lends itself to the laid-back, relaxing vibe. Only catch: the damn place closes at 11, but don't let that get you down, because Fly Bar is a cigarette drag away!
author: Drew S.

description: Small and quaint place for a mellow night out w/ friends.  This place is not crowded at all and seats are easy to get.  Had great time here conversing w/ friends on a friday night. Although they only offer beers and champange, its still for a good price of $5!!.  Great champange drinks combo too! Try their lychee martini.  Some drawback? the place closes at midnight, which can be a drag if you want to extend your night and its cash only.
author: Amelia S.

description: I'm Korean and let me tell you, I know a thing or two (or three) about soju.  The soju-tini's here are good enuff to get me out of my kimchi squat and into the bar yelling, "jom duh joo say yo!"
author: Julie H.

description: I really like this bar, particularly since it's in my boyfriend's neighborhood and almost always has a seat for us or us and our friends.  I am not a hard alcohol gal, so the wine/beer/sake menu is fine for me.  The bartenders are usually friendly and low-key.
author: Molly R.

description:
I'll give the place props for keeping it simple.  Small drink selection but excellent quality and price.  The Lychee Mermaid was as good as everyone says, however...the lychee at the bottom sort of made me want to vom.  I ate it because it was taking up space where more booze should have been. So, it got what it deserved.

The sake based drinks are pretty delish and the atmosphere felt intimate and familiar.  Being from out of town, I did feel like I was crashing a private party, but the service was so friendly and nice that it made up for feeling a little out of place.
author: H. H.

description: I am hesitant to review this place, as I just don't want everyone to know about it. Bar 821 is just a great neighborhood bar. Its usually not too crowded and the bar tenders there always make a point of trying to help you find a seat, and work with the customers to make sure people are comfortable. Clearly this may not be the case every night but the dozen or so times I have been has resulted in a good time. Also the place closes at midnight so this helps keep the place from filling up too badly. They have chimay on tap and their cocktails from what I remember are tasty and well done.
author: Alexis G.

description: A nice little hidden oasis of cheap happy hour drinks.  It's only open till 11, but for some reason this fact seems only to enhance the integrity of this alamo square bar.  The sign says to keep it a secret, but I think the secret's out.  By the way, the Guiness Bubbly is pretty good.
author: Sarah S.

description: Small, dimly lit, cheaper to get a bottle of wine than drink by the glass.  All good things.
author: darla s.

description: This is a great neighborhood bar with super cheap happy hour specials and a really friendly bartender.  I only wish I lived closer!
author: Jessica B.

description: Really nice atmosphere. Came here early Friday night, not crowded at all, so it's chill and comfortable.
author: Yuchi C.

description: This is my favorite bar in my 'hood. I've made ass here so many times and they still allow me back in. You gotta love joey. The only bad thing I can say about it is that they close too early. My favorite drink is the "ginger" ~ It's medicinal.
author: Babs P.

description: Neat, chill bar. Nice place to go with a few friends - but not too many (it's really small). They have pretty good drink specials on Fridays.
author: Dana L.

description: Psst.....Very pleasant neighborhood bar on Divis.  The decor is dark yet warm with orange hues and fabulous artwork that complements the ambiance.  The simple bar offerings of beer, wine & champagne made it easy for me to cozy up to my cute date and my generous pour of shiraz.  Great place for convos or cuddling in the candlelight.  The staff was attentive and helpful, but I do have to agree that the early weeknight closing time kinda sucks.  Just as I was getting comfy in my booth, which had a great view of bustling Divis and the pouring rain, the bartender came over to warn us it was last call at 10:30!  But it was way worth the trip and there are plenty of late-night alternatives nearby.  Bar 821 is a pleasurable little secret... but it didn't come from me : )
author: Tara G.

description: Very cool bar, and the perfect place to hang out while you wait for your table at Little Star to open up.
author: shoba d.

description: Why did it take me 2.5 years to finally mosey into Bar 821? Always on the list of "oh, we need to drop in there this weekend" but never happened. Finally on a Friday night  we dropped in and had a great time! Our bartender was super-fun and quite the character (even though that comment about Alan Parsons Project made me feel OLD I won't hold it against him). If I could give bonus stars for atmosphere I would. The drinks were yummy and the prices were average for the city. Oddly enough, despite the modern decor, Bar 821 had the feel of a true Irish pub. Good drinks, food brought in from elsewhere, fun bartender, small neighborhood feel and the obligatory TV showing a sports game.  Love it!
author: Sarcastic T.

description: Okay - nice vibe. Feels like a polished version of a type of bar you might find in New York, or, oddly, Puerto Rico. Drinks were good. The time I was there i also ordered a pretty tasty upscale Mac & Cheese.
author: Karsten P.

description: Top 5 favorite bar in town. If the fact that my Pac Heights dwelling ass will recommend this place to any friend in need of a great date spot, then I guess the "secret is out."  I personally could give care less if the neighborhood hipsters are offended by my presence. Between the yummy drinks, the dark & sexy lighting, and the speakeasy vibe, this place is tops in my book. Probably doesn't hurt that I have a great memory from one specific evening spent here, but that's a different story.
author: Chris B.

description: I had never heard about this place until this evening.  It's down the street from a friends house.  I loved this little space....comfy benches and tasty champagne cocktails.  I even felt comfortable here after my girlfriend was so kind as to tell me that I looked like a mountain girl...oh no.....time to spend more than 5 minutes to dress comfy before leaving the house.
author: Brye L.

description: Nice place to hang out. I would say that works for a group of friends of both genders, or a date. Not to go with your buddies. For that you don't need the nice atmosphere of Bar 821 !
author: Javi V.

description: I very much enjoy their champagne cocktails - particularly during their amazingly priced happy hour ($3!!). I don't know if this is simply my own misguided impression, but the atmosphere here always strikes me as perfect for intimate chatting and getting to know someone new.
author: Abigail R.

description: I've only been here once but I've been hankering to go back ever since.   I too indulged in the Valentine that fateful night and it has become the cupcake darling of my alcoholic repertoire.
author: Ky W.

description: You know those complicated drinks that involve dropping shots of whatever into half filled pints of beer? Well I could SWEAR that the bartender was making these complicated drinks with half filled pints of champagne. The fact that the tattoo guy from the tattoo place next door was the one drinking them just added to the ambience because seriously...any place where badasses shoot champagne is MY KIND OF PLACE. Badasses shooting champagne for only $3 is just icing on the cake.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I'm not sure how I feel about Bar 821. It has some good things going for it: cozy, good bartender, decent selection of beers and wines. On the other hand, it's noisy and crowded even on weeknights, it closes early, and it lacks a hard liquor license. It's a nice enough place to stop in on your way to somewhere else, or if you're waiting for a table at Little Star Pizza across the street. And it's a cool enough spot if you live in NOPA or have a date there. However, I definitely wouldn't travel out of my way to get here.
author: Bradd S.

description: It's got a european feel with all the candles/low seating in there, which makes for a nice spot to sit, talk and chill. Joey's got the whole bar to himself in there, and he runs the place real well. They've got all kindsa tasty drinks in there, not to mention Hoegaarden on tap which is niiiiiiiice.
author: Justin H.

description: They have a wonderful happy hour.  Go here for the champagne with strawberries and chocolate in each glass.
author: Joanna S.

description: I love this place. I live in the neighborhood and have been coming here since it was a "secret bar". Well it's no longer secret but it is still a great bar. All the bartenders are friendly, the sake/soju drinks are great, the wine selection decent and the beer selection is well chosen. It's also a great place for a date! Come here...you'll have a good time.
author: Steve H.

description: Even though they don't serve hard liquor - the prices on their wines, beers and sake drinks are really good.  $5 for a champagne cocktail, I will drink to that any day of the week (literally)!
author: Katie P.

description: Nice small mellow bar, with comfy seats and kinda like a mix between a divey bar made over to a loungey dark cavey den.  I don't think i'd have much reason to go back, unless I was eating at Tsunami again (since they are two almost-next-door siblings of a semi-big family i guess), but it was comfy and the drinks were good and not too pricey.  Hard to choose between 3 or 4 stars.  Parking in the area sucks.
author: Today Y.

description: The drinks are frikin good.  I loved the pink panther and the Lychee champange cocktails.  The happy hour has to be the best deal in town
author: Chris W J.

description: Always love anywhere that serves Leffe in the true Leffe glass. Tried the apple mojito, not much alcohol but tasty. Good dark atmosphere and tunes.
author: Amanda H.

description: The bar tender is so funny and nice, we had a cool duet singing to the music on the tv screen. The bench is so comfy the seats suck and hurt your back. Change the seats and it's ll good!
author: Karen T.

description: By far my favorite bar on Divisadero.  Joey the bartender is awesome, happy hour is from 5-7 pm and drinks are $3!  $3!  No liquor though.  There is a TV to catch up on Sports, go Suns!  The ambiance is loungy and on some nights, there are some cute girls.
author: Christian N.

description: When I walked into this bar, it was love at first sight. Zoolander was playing on the television and the musical selection for the evening was The Streets. Despite the fact that it was a Saturday night, it was not overcrowded and it was easy to get a drink. My drink cost a little more than I expected, but  it was also much larger than I expected. What a pleasant suprise. The ambiance was lovely, the seating was plentiful, and my date was audible. It was an evening well spent. The only downfall was that it closed early, but apparently people live upstairs so that makes sense.
author: reina t.

description: WTF? 4 stars? Bullshit. This place sucks. Where to start? Since it's a bar, maybe I'll start at the drinks. Drink options totally suck. Beer or wine. That's about it. Very limited, and all the choices suck. I got a pathetic beer that was so bad I could not even finish it. The server was a total bitch. Completely cold and careless and hostile and rude. Ignored me for a long time then rudely took my order and threw the beer on the bar. The foam went over the top for a while, leaving me with a sticky filthy glass covered with beer in a puddle of beer. Very nice. Music sucked and was way too loud. Stupid flat screen TV on the wall. Why the fuck would someone want to go to a bar to watch a screen that they can't hear? It's stupid. Get rid of it. There's enough bloody TV all over the place these days. And, on a freezing cold pre-winter night, they left the front and back doors open, so one had to totally freeze and could not try to enjoy being there. Incredibly loud. Could not hear my companion and she could not hear me. Oh, I could go on. But you get the idea. Went over to "mini bar" afterwards and what a relief it was to be there after this hell hole.
author: Eater S.

description:
This is a great place to sit and have casual drinks and catch up with friends.  The bartender is so friendly, he truly is what makes this place!

I would definitely go back!
author: bree s.

description:
there is something to be said about walking into your local bar and already having your drink on the counter before you even sit down...
joey makes me a happy girl on any given night with his quips, don't give a damn attitude, and his delightful music selections. all in all happy to be home in 821, even if it "was" a secret
author: o. c.

description: I love this bar. We'll come all the way from Bernal Heights just for a couple of drinks here, because it's relaxed, easy to find somewhere to sit, serves BIG beers and shows Spinal Tap on the flat-screen. The fact they close early seems to deter a lot of hipsters and yuppies which makes it all the more appealing. If I want to drink after 821 closes there are plenty of other options. Up until they close however, I'm staying right there.
author: Neil S.

description: Bar 821 covets itself as a neighborhood bar, but they keep the place lit so darkly that if you head in during happy hour it feels like a cave.  If however, you'd like to get out of the sun for a few hours or love $3 beers/saktails than this is an ideal place.  Franz Kaner on tap and other Belgian treats fits with the nice selection of beer.  The biggest downfall, aside from being so damn dark is that like some bars on Divisadero they don't have a full liquor license, so while it may say cocktails on the sign outside those are made with soju or sake.  All in all, this place has a great decor and a great happy hour, so if you're in the area and your thirsty before the clock strikes 7 its worth dropping in.
author: Ed B.

description: Nice conversational, comfortable alternative to the wall-to-wall youngster scene that you're likely to find at other neighborhood haunts.  Killer happy hour features $3 Belgians.
author: Brant O.

description: Not a lot there, but it's mostly good.  The happy hour deal is great, they mostly have belgian beers, but only like 8 beers total.  They have a lot of champagne.  It's one of the happy hour specials. Some of their cocktails are good but some are absolutely foul.  Dark and quiet,  so it could be a good alternative if you're not in the mood for the energy of Fly, across the street.  Right by Little Star Pizza which, I know from experience, can be a good combination.
author: Heidi P.

description: Impulsive choice, was on my way to the bamboo hut, but curiosity always gets the better half of me. For once I was actually sober before I hit the bar, but that would all change in minutes to come. Definitely a very intimate kinda place but although small did not seem to get overly crowded. The bartenders had good suggestions and I was all for trying out new and exotic drinks. That said we tried everything from wine to shots to those fruit infused cocktails. The portions were small but very potent. Out of the numerous bars in san francisco this place is almost a hidden gem....that is until it was first reviewed on yelp.
author: Raj K.

description: Bar 821 is very simple. Beer and Wine, nuff said. 821 is very dim which sets the mood. I gave this place only 4 stars because they close so damn early. Fucking ELEVEN! Overall, it is a great place to hang out and talk nonsense with your buddies. See you there!
author: Danny D.

description: Also a favorite local hang out. Cozy, intimate bar with dim lighting...great ambiance. They only serve beer and wine which is perfect since I'm a self-proclaimed wineo. The selection, to be honest, isn't extensive, but it's pretty reasonably priced and if you can nab a table it's a great spot to chill and spend your evening.
author: Shannon C.

description:
Great, small neighborhood bar.  And even though I'm not a regular, each time I've been in there, everyone was very friendly which is rare at some of these places.  Over sized drafts that get even cheaper at happy hour, plus a great wine selection.

Music played by the bartenders is always fantastic as well, which is a nice surprise.
author: Kris E.

description: This is me and my girlfriends favorite sunday spot. No hard alcohol but the bartender "James" always takes great care of us. Keep the champagne cocktails coming.
author: brad b.

description:
I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could. 

Why 3.5? 
1. only one Zinfandel on the wine list (not an issue for all)
2. really noisy, which made it difficult to carry on a conversation

But... it's close to my house, has a good happy hour and seemed pretty chill. I'll try it again to see if I just caught it on a really loud night (Wednesday).
author: Kelly B.

description: I love their Luxury Mojitos.  A nice place to have drinks with friends and you can talk without having to compete with the sound of loud music.  We will be back....very soon!
author: Leah V.

description: I really like this bar. It's very laidback and pretty small. It seems more of a place to sit down & talk with your friends -- it's not the kind of place where everyone is standing & you have to squeeze through a huge crowd. I don't mind that they don't have hard liquor -- I find their champagne cocktails pretty delicious. So far, the Lemon Spark is my favorite, but I've also had the Lychee Mermaid (yummy) and the Raspberry one with the dried hibiscus in it....I intend to try all of them. The happy hour does indeed make me happy because champagne cocktails are only $3, and I can bring in Popeye's from down the street too. Mmm. Not exactly sure why all the reviews rave about the bartenders; they seem fine but a little inattentive (wrapped up in convo with regulars and/or friends, it seems to me).
author: Amy K.

description:
we really, really wanted to like this bar as the bouncer was cool and they were showing "Airplane!"  whats not to love?  apparently the staff's bedtime is 11 PM.  The prices are awesome and they had tiger beer but the bartender acted legitimately pissed off that we had showed up and were (very politely) going to order a couple beers.   sorry we had the audacity to order DRINKS in your BAR, bitch.  they acted as though the concept that someone would show up at ten thirty on a saturday night was completely out of line.  does anyone else understand how this is a successful business model for a bar?  neither do we.  so after killing our three dollar anchor steams  - granted, they do have great prices - we headed off to our favorite neighborhood lower haight bars that stay open til 2 like normal drinking establishments, where the bartenders are at least nonplussed by your ordering a beer as opposed to downright irritated that you would presume to do so.

prices are great, but have a good buzz going or be a sociopath in preparation for awkwardness.
author: noah s.

description: shhh. don't tell anyone about this place!  good wine/champagne/mixed drinks, not too overcrowded, and a friendly bar staff. some nibbles would enhance the experience and make me stay longer, but really, how many glasses of bubbly can one girl drink?
author: Bee H.

description: Nice place, cool booth seats, dark but clean, good music, sports on the TV, my all-around favorite neighborhood bar! Actually it's nearly the only bar I even go to in this god-forsaken city anymore. They have a bunch of foo-foo girly champagne drinks and a wide selection of beers for the guy. Great Mojitos, and soju drinks. My favorite is the Valentine, champagne with a stawbery and chocolate piece. The chocolate and strawberry add a delicious touchto the flavor of the pagne. A fun place to relax after work, start out a night on the town, or even just come for some quiet evening romantic conversation. No one here gets rowdy (prolly cause it's beer and wine only), nobody is rude, no one is flagrantly doing coke in the restroom, the bartenders are nice, the people are cool, and it's got the greatest happy hour menu ever. What is there not to like about this place? NOTHING. It's f!@#ing perfect. Thanks guys!
author: Robin B.

description: i love this bar.  however, we just threw a private event there and unless your friends are alcoholics, there is no way to meet the minimum they require--because they only serve beer and wine.  it was a great space for our party, but we ended up fronting $500, which sucked.  we had close to 100 people there, and we were still that far from the minimum.  just something to consider if you rent the space out for a private event.  other than that, i love 821.  it's the perfect blend of wine bar and dive.
author: K H.

description: 821 tells its patrons not to tell anyone about them yet it advertises heavily on guardian. what's up with that? 821 is an excellent bar/lounge and certainly doesn't need such gimmickry. the place is laid out nicely to maximize its diminutive space. the crowd is attractive and mellow. the beer selection is outstanding with plenty of german and belgian beers. the friendly bartenders know what they're doing. more importantly, no attitude... 821 is at the cusp of 5 stars but deserves 4 stars due to its early closing hours (zoning issue). i guess that makes 821 a good neighbor even if it's by default. that's always a good thing.
author: frisco j.

description: nice 1st impression...........chill, dim, hip, cozy, intimate, loungey bar, i especially like the comfy long bench/couch seating slightly reclined meant to really lounge against the walls.........      though its not my scene, it was pretty damn chill -- people were mellow, laid back,  into their own conversations, wasn't crowded that night so didn't have to yell in conversation.   great to have wine, but that night i had a $5 lychee soju cocktail that actually gave me a nice buzz.
author: Cindi N.

description: Try the Lychee Mermaid! It's surprisingly fun and delicious.
author: Jason S.

description: i like this place. my friends and i were looking for a place to grab a drink while we waited for a table at little star. we walked around the neighborhood, walking in and out of a couple other bars. bar 821 was just what we were looking for. dark, intimate, ample seating. they don't serve hard liquor, so i ordered a sparkling ginger which turned out to be quite yummy. the bartender was friendly and the atmosphere was casual and unpretentious. this is the kind of bar i would go to more often if i lived in the area. it would be great for a group of friends or a date.
author: Elena M.

description: perfect little loungey place. we need more like it in SF. and the lack of liquor keeps the crazies from coming out. wine, sake, beer and champagne. good enough for me.
author: Cameo E.

description: the peeps who own tsunami and cafe abir own this place. and like the others, it's too kool for skool and really nuthin' special.
author: rerun w.

description: waiting for a table at tsunami or at little star?  head over to bar 821.  you won't be disappointed by their champagne drinks.
author: Tim G.

description:
love this place for happy hour
5-7 pm daily, $3 champagne cocktails, including a lecee one, soju drinks and beer

tv..music was a pleasant talking volume....good window space and cute tables all around!

don't go in at the end of the happy hour...it does not make the bartender very happy
author: Kate R.

description: sojo & champagne cocktails w/ lychee.  good decor, though not open late.
author: Liz V.

description:
champagne..the key to any girls heart...or rather this girl's heart....automatic 4 stars...

their ginger champagne cocktail and the valentine (?) were excellent...
author: Joy Y.

description: just the right size, just the right atmosphere and they have creative bubbly, for the love.  bar 821 has hit the spot every time.
author: julia p.

description: been here for the grand opening night, haven't been back since.  one star better than the fly bar.
author: Pickle R.

description: Great suds and saki drinks at great prices.  Get the evening started here because the door closes at 10:00
author: Dave S.

description: This was the first bar I ever went to in San Francisco (Feb 2005) and I've been coming back ever since. It's right around the corner/across the street from Tsunami/Little Star which is nice when you're waiting for your table to become available. But the real draw is the champagne cocktails, my fave being the sparkling ginger. For $5 ($3 if you get there before 7), you get a tasty, bubbly gingery concoction. And once you've had a few too many of those, you have the option to switch to a nice pint or a glass of wine. The ambiance is totally chill- candlelit with some comfy benches (although the accompanying chairs totally blow- good excuse to sit next to your honey for better hand-on-thigh action). In addition, there's always a classic cult movie playing on the TV (muted) with the bartender's ipod at work (he plays good stuff). The bar closes early, so get there early, get down to business and be in bed by 11:30 with a good buzz on.
author: Billy L.

description: 821 is the shit. locals. cool spot. good beers and wines. i heart the bartenders and they treat me like a neighborhood regualr even though i dont live here. unpretentious. fun. nice people. good stuff.
author: kelly M.

description: i dream about the lychee mermaid - a champagne cocktail with a lychee. it's worth the trip.
author: J K.
